body: **** *** VS Code Version: Version: 1.104.3 (Universal)** Commit: e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92 Date: 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z Electron: 37.3.1 ElectronBuildId: 12404162 Chromium: 138.0.7204.235 Node.js: 22.18.0 V8: 13.8.258.31-electron.0 OS: Darwin arm64 24.6.0 *** OS Version: MacOS Sequoia 15.7.1 (24G231)** **Steps to Reproduce:** 1. Please create a workspace with the "settings.json" that I have attached ```json { "editor.unicodeHighlight.ambiguousCharacters": true, "editor.unicodeHighlight.includeComments": true, "editor.unicodeHighlight.includeStrings": true, "editor.unicodeHighlight.invisibleCharacters": true, "editor.unicodeHighlight.nonBasicASCII": true, "editor.unicodeHighlight.allowedLocales": { "_os": false, "_vscode": false }, "editor.unicodeHighlight.allowedCharacters": { "‘": true, // `U+2018` (“Left Single Quotation Mark”); "’": true, // `U+2019` (“Right Single Quotation Mark”); "“": true, // `U+201C` (“Left Double Quotation Mark”); "”": true, // `U+201D` (“Right Double Quotation Mark”). "𝑈": true, // `U+1D448` ("Mathematical Italic Capital U"); "𝑢": true, // `U+1D462` ("Mathematical Italic Small U"); "𝜃": true, // `U+1D703` ("Mathematical Italic Small Theta"); "°": true, // `U+00B0` ("Degree Sign"); "†": true, // `U+2020` ("Dagger"); "‖": true, // `U+2016` ("Double Vertical Line"); "𝑥": true, // `U+1D465` ("Mathematical Italic Small X"); "𝕫": true, // `U+1D56B` ("Mathematical Double-Struck Small Z"); "𓀀": true, // 'U+13000' ("Egyptian Hieroglyph A001"); "𠀀": true // 'U+20000' ("CJK Unified Ideograph-20000"). } } ``` 2. Create or use the Test.txt file that I have attached ```markdown ‘ 𝑈 𝑈a ° 𝜃 𝜃c 𝕫 ``` 3. Open the folder in Workspace Trusted 4. Notice the Unicode characters with Code points U+1D448, U+1D462, U+1D703, U+1D465, U+13000 etc. are being highlighted as suspicious, even though we explicitly whitelisted and allowed them through. The BMP characters are not highlighted, supplementary plane characters, remain highlighted even though they are whitelisted, it has issues for higher code-points that need two code-points to represent. 5. Also notice that if we add any extra character (including space) after a supplementary plane character, the highlight disappears. If it is not the last character before the newline, the highlighting disappears. **--Expected Behaviour--** None of the whitelisted, allowed characters should be highlighted **--Additional Information--** I tried disabling all extensions and enabling workspace trust, but this issue persisted. All of the relevant screenshots along with the "settings.json", and Test.txt are attached, kindly refer [settings.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22665633/settings.json) [Test.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22665663/Test.txt)

I had updated my VS Code to the latest stable release, **version: 1.104.3** (Universal) but the **issue still persists**. The Unicode characters in the supplementary plane are still being incorrectly highlighted even though they are explicitly whitelisted. Additionally, I’ve noticed several edge cases that demonstrate inconsistent behavior and provide more nuance To reproduce, kindly copy from below or find the Test2.txt file attached with this comment for reference (@hediet) ```markdown 𝑈 𝑈d d𝑈 𝑈𝑈𝑈 𝑈 𝑈 𝑈 𝑈𝑈𝑈d ``` **Line 1, 3, 4, and 6:** When a supplementary-plane character appears as the **last character in a line**, the highlight behaves problematically. Notice in **Line 2**, the BMP character is the last character in the line, after the supplementary plane character, and highlighting is not present. **Line 5:** If a **trailing space** is added after a supplementary-plane character, the highlight disappears, even though the character itself is unchanged. **Line 4:** When **supplementary-plane characters are next to each other**, and the **last character** in that sequence is also a supplementary-plane character, the highlighting still behaves problematically. **Line 6:** Adding a space **between** such characters does not stop the highlighting. I'm attaching all the relevant files and images with this comment, thank you [Test2.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22701468/Test2.txt) [settings.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22701469/settings.json)

title: faking MCP use

body: Clicking this action I was expecting a dialog, like we had for chat:

comments.body: I fixed this with a notification https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/269556
I think the modal is a bit in your face. LMK what you think.

@meganrogge the user explicitly wanted to do dictation, and we want the user to succeed by installing the speech extension. A notification just increases your chance of loosing the user because that notification is showing non-blocking in a different location.

As a rule of thumb, I would always pick a dialog over a notification if the user explicitly triggered it from a menu or button.

body:
Type: Bug I am not sure who is creating these obj folders and corresponding *AssemblyInfo.cs files (VS Code, C# Extension, Copilot, etc), but when I open a C# file outside the context of a solution or project in VS Code extra folders and files are automatically generated in the same directory of my C# file that, in turn, break the overall build of my project or solution. When I open my files within the context of a .NET solution using the C# Dev Kit, build artifacts and files are created in their appropriate place. It's not clear to me why this obj folder is created or what purpose it serves. title: Build failure trying to access key vault secrets: Could not fetch access token for Azure. Status code: invalid_client,

body:
```
bash: basename: command not found
bash: uname: command not found
bash: sed: command not found
bash: sed: command not found
()
REDMOND+kanadig@kanadig-dev1 MINGW64 /c/GIT/projects/vscode-copilot-evaluation
```

basename and uname was from activate script. sed might be from shell integration script? 

/cc @karthiknadig

comments.body:
We do have references to `sed` in shell integration bash script: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/6711af16e505bfcf2f1a4763e05263459dcd6b2b/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminal/common/scripts/shellIntegration-bash.sh#L214 
and 
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/6711af16e505bfcf2f1a4763e05263459dcd6b2b/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminal/common/scripts/shellIntegration-bash.sh#L402 

So maybe they are what is showing this. I haven't seen this come up in issues though, and has been there for either 15 month or 3years. 

Maybe the bash version is just super old??

title: sed: command not found shows up when opening gitbash terminal

body: /cc @karthiknadig

comments.body: Turns out it is properly activated, but we need to account for two more things here. So activation happens, it is just not visible. There is really two other issues: Problem 1. Why is (venv) not showing up 2. Why does shell integration break when activate.ps1 is ran in the terminal. ---------------------------------------------- Problem 1. This is probably because we save https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/e0dada76949dc8179d5c8e03f1bae491c0c2ec51/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminal/common/scripts/shellIntegration.ps1#L17 PRE Python activate script. We should update OriginalPrompt again after the activate in case that runs. Problem 2.. Terminal shell integration gets lost/borked This is where activation script gets run in core: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/96aa43fe7aaedd4251a8f99572c569825950a9cf/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminal/common/scripts/shellIntegration.ps1#L84 We lose shell integration if we run activate.ps1 in terminal.

Forking off the second problem to: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/269741 

So problem 1 can go in as candidate

title: Transfer

body: When changing some settings (e.g. "window.border"), I get the following prompt: I occasionally perform command-line git operations (e.g. changing branches) that change values in a checked-in VS Code settings file such that VS Code thinks a restart is required. This isn't always true, which is its own issue. But regardless, users should have the opportunity to postpone the restart, hence the prompt. However, **the prompt has some properties that combine in a rather problematic way: (a) it is a modal, focus-stealing dialog, and (b) "Restart" is selected by default.** It often happens that I start typing another command right after the first, not expecting the prompt to appear, but **the dialog steals focus and I inadvertently confirm the restart with a keystroke** before I realize what is happening. Needless to say, this is a particularly frustrating UX interaction.
title: Safer restart prompt

body:
Unable to use Import Modes via `vscode` link for internal hosted files as described in the release notes: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/742c75e7ed099f7709414901682fe9d1e130220a/CHANGELOG.md?plain=1#L636

It works for files hosted on GitHub as you see in [awesome-copilot](https://github.com/github/awesome-copilot/blob/main/README.prompts.md), but I would like to create an internal prompt repo that users can install prompt files from.

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.3
- VS Code Version: 1.104.2
- OS Version: WIndows_NT x64 10.0.22631
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Import chat-prompt from `vscode` url
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): NA
- Logs: VS Code Logs from Output > Window
      ```
      2025-10-02 11:13:13.805 [error] [Network] #56: http://localhost:8000/example.prompt.md - error GET Failed to fetch
      2025-10-02 11:13:13.806 [error] [Window] Error handling prompt URL vscode:chat-prompt/install?url%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8000%2Fexample.prompt.md Failed to fetch
      ```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a prompt file `example.prompt.md`
2. Serve via http `python3 -m http.server 8000`
3. open link vscode:chat-prompt/install?url=http://localhost:8000/example.prompt.md
4. Get a pop up
      ```
      An external application wants to create a prompt file with content from a URL. Do you want to continue by selecting a destination folder and name?
      This will access [http://localhost:8000/example.prompt.md](vscode-file://vscode-app/c:/Program%20Files/Microsoft%20VS%20Code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-browser/workbench/workbench.html).
      
      If you did not initiate this request, it may represent an attempted attack on your system. Unless you took an explicit action to initiate this request, you should press 'No'
      ```
5. Click 'Yes' to accept
6. Expect Github Copilot to ask where to save prompt file, but nothing happens except Output > Window shows the error logs above.  Also, http server doesn't log any attempted HTTP GET request.

Remediation Steps Attempted:
1. Added internal domain to Trusted Domains

comments.body: I realized that the link I put in the issue wasn't rendering.  copy and paste this in your browser: `vscode:chat-prompt/install?url=http://localhost:8000/example.prompt.md`

body: Seen on macOS 1. Get the agent session into a state where it asks the user whether it should continue to watch a terminal command, eg: 2. Open a new workspace in another window, make sure it's in the foreground 3. Quit VS Code 4. Launch VS Code 🐛 Desktop notification comes up, despite the fact that the user can't really do nothing right now:

comments.body: Sounds similar to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/269412 but I assume this was the latest insiders?
I believe @connor4312 added the user confirmation notification. I wonder if I'm not doing something with that prompt that I should be when the window is closed to set the state 🤔

Oh, I see, `showingButtons` is used to determine what happens... maybe that's `true` for the terminal one 

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/5de1bbf5dac7e9d2105f368fe082fbab031fd8d6/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatContentParts/chatConfirmationWidget.ts#L238
No, looks like this would repro whenever a user has not clicked the buttons - regardless of the consumer
I was planning to pair with my onboarding person to fix this today :)

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
The Snap package provides the binaries on Ubuntu for x86 but not on arm64. Now that arm64 binaries are available, I suppose they could easily be snap'd too. There are more and more arm64 machines out there (From Based on Snapdragons, Nvidia Grace, Apple Mx).

Also, the Codium project does release a snap for arm, so there is no technical issue - the package is done already.

If a PR like that would be accepted, I'll be happy to submit it.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->

# Missing Stop Button and Model Selector in GitHub Copilot Chat (WSL Environment)

Description: The GitHub Copilot Chat interface is missing essential UI elements: the stop button (to interrupt generation) and the model selector dropdown. This affects both the chat panel and inline chat (Ctrl+I), making it impossible to stop ongoing AI generation except by closing/reopening the chat panel.

# Steps to Reproduce:

Open VS Code in WSL environment
Open GitHub Copilot Chat panel (Ctrl+Shift+I)
Ask any question that triggers AI generation
Observe that no stop button appears during generation
Also note that no model selector dropdown is visible in the interface

# Expected Behavior:

Stop button (⏹️) should appear during AI generation to allow interruption
Model selector dropdown should be visible to choose between available AI models
Escape key should stop generation
Actual Behavior:

No stop button visible during generation
No model selector dropdown visible
Escape key does not stop generation
Inline chat also does not have stop button
Only way to stop generation is to close and reopen the chat panel

# Environment:

VS Code Version: 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92)
OS: Linux (WSL2) - Ubuntu on Windows
Remote: WSL extension
GitHub Copilot Extension: 1.372.0
GitHub Copilot Chat Extension: 0.31.3
Node.js: v24.4.1
Troubleshooting Attempted:

✅ Restarted VS Code multiple times
✅ Reinstalled both Copilot extensions
✅ Tried pre-release versions of extensions
✅ Cleared VS Code extension cache and storage
✅ Tested both chat panel and inline chat (Ctrl+I)
✅ Verified GitHub authentication is working
❌ Issue persists across all troubleshooting steps

Additional Context: This appears to be a UI rendering issue specific to WSL environments. The missing UI elements suggest a broader problem with how the Copilot Chat interface renders in remote VS Code setups. Both the stop button and model selector are core features that significantly impact usability.

Workaround: Currently using close/reopen chat panel to stop generation, but this is disruptive to workflow.

title: Auto mode throws error mid conversation

body:
"Adding a folder to workspace" instantly reloads a window, killing execution of running Jupyter code.

Running long lasting jobs, such as downloading datasets, might take a few hours, and hitting "Add folder to workspace" instantly kills the state of running Jupyter. That's really frustrating and I think there must be some kind of warning to the user that processes running in Jupyter would be terminated. VSCode behavior feels really hostile and disrespectful to  Jupyter experience. It treats jupyter integration like its a toy thing for quick throwaway scripts.

<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
Yes
<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.103.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 22.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run a cell in Jupyter notebook, e.g. ```while True: pass```
2. While it is running, select "File"->"Add folder to workspace". This turns a single root worspace to multi-root workspace.
3. See Jupyter calculations terminated and losing all state, without any warning.

comments.body:
Thanks for creating this issue! It looks like you may be using an old version of VS Code, the latest stable release is 1.104.2. Please try upgrading to the latest version and checking whether this issue remains.

Happy Coding!

Restart of extension host can be prevented by components and this is an area where notebooks need to prevent it if they want to. For example debug does, if you debug an extension while adding a root folder: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/148542970d877c495d49c283e39b18df5b7d81a4/src/vs/workbench/contrib/debug/browser/debugService.ts#L208-L213

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Right now when we log events for /response or /panel.request, we list "auto" as the Properties.model attribute. We should add another attribute that indicates the model associated with the response - maybe Properties.modelInvoked. This would be useful beyond just auto in the case where there is a bug that the model returned is not the model indicated in the selection. 

@isidorn

title: Model Not Available

body:
Type: Bug It seems copilot is not able to detect when the command execution is completed and it hangs forever. Checking the vs code output logs it looks like Copilot wait was completed before it let the actual command finish. so in my case copilot executed this: `cd /Users/REDACTED_PATH/noe-oss && go test -tags=license -v . -run "TestLicenses"` the terminal shows that it was completed at 14:04:17 however the terminal output logs show this: ``` 2025-10-02 14:02:30.550 [info] autoApprove: All sub-commands NOT auto-approved [] 2025-10-02 14:02:30.550 [info] autoApprove: Command line NOT auto-approved [] 2025-10-02 14:02:30.550 [info] - Command 'cd /Users/REDACTED_PATH/noe-oss' is approved by allow list rule: cd [] 2025-10-02 14:02:30.550 [info] - Command 'go test -tags=license -v . -run "TestLicenses"' has no matching auto approve entries [] 2025-10-02 14:02:30.551 [info] - Command line 'cd /Users/REDACTED_PATH/noe-oss && go test -tags=license -v . -run "TestLicenses"' has no matching auto approve entries [] 2025-10-02 14:02:44.853 [info] ToolTerminalCreator#createTerminal: Waiting 5000ms for shell integration [] 2025-10-02 14:02:46.793 [info] ToolTerminalCreator#_waitForShellIntegration: Timed out 200ms, using basic SI (via listener) [] 2025-10-02 14:02:46.793 [info] ToolTerminalCreator#_waitForShellIntegration: Promise complete, disposing store [] ``` Which shows a `14:02:46.793` timestamp. At this point, Copilot chat keeps showing the spinning wheel, waiting for command completion. For context, I use zsh shell customized with p10k.zsh theme. <!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? => No, it interacts with gopls so the question doesn't apply to this issue.

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 
```
1.104.2
e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92
arm64
```
- OS Version: 
```
Darwin Kernel Version 23.4.0: 
root:xnu-10063.101.17~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T6000 arm64
```

Steps to Reproduce:

This is an issue regarding on LSP, and the original issue is https://github.com/golang/go/issues/75275.

In gopls we have found we return the [folding range correctly for if-else statement](https://github.com/golang/go/issues/75275#issuecomment-3299277414). But gopls doesn't respect them correctly.

```
$ nl -ba ./a.go 
     1	package tools
     2	
     3	func _() {
     4		if true {
     5	
     6		} else {
     7			// else block is not foldable.
     8		}
     9	
    10		if true {
    11	
    12		} else if true {
    13			// else-if block is not foldable.
    14		} else {
    15	
    16		}
    17	}

$ gopls folding_ranges ./a.go 
3:11-17:1
4:11-6:2
6:10-8:2
10:11-12:2
12:18-14:2
14:10-16:2
```

I suspect the latter folding is skipped if the ending range of Nth folding range is overlapping with N+1 th folding range. But I don't find any documentation about this.

Could I clarify how to tackle this, should it be tackled by LSP side(means shouldn't return folding ranges that the end of a range and the start of another range are on the same line), or it's vscode issue?

Thanks:)

cc: @adonovan
title: VS Code displays no fold option for else/elseif block in gopls

<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->

<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104.2 (Universal)
- OS Version: MacOS Sequoia 15.6

As I'm typing (without copilot on), VSCode is constantly trying to suggest word completion. 

Hitting the period key accepts the suggested completion, which is very very often wrong.

Then one has to hit the undo key (cmd-Z) to undo the bad completion -- but next time you type the same leading characters, it makes the same suggestion again and you have to undo again/

Desired -- if vscode makes a suggestion and auto-accepts it (because I hit period or whatever) -- AND I IMMEDIATELY UNDO RIGHT AFTER -- don't make that suggestion again.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In a JS file, let's say I have an import `CD` which I use to reference module variables, e.g. `CD.someVar` or `CD.someFunc`.
2. I type `CD.` because I want to type `CD.someVar`.
3. When I type the period, VSCode auto-accepts it's suggestion of `CDATASection` -- WHICH HAS NEVER APPEARED IN ANY OF MY CODE -- and I have to "undo"  to get rid of `CDATASection` to continue what I was typing.
4. This is not great, but it happens EVERY TIME I type `CD.` which gets old really fast, and makes me want to turn off suggestions entirely.

I'm looking in preferences and I see that I can change `Quick Suggestions Delay` -- setting this to 500 helps, at least I can bang out `CD.xxx` before the suggestion comes up.

After 10 minutes of digging, I found "Accept Suggestion on Commit Character" -- turning that off solves the problem, but it was hard to find -- and doesn't tell me what the commit characters are.
title: Hitting undo after code completion should signal that completion was not wanted

comments.body:
Thanks for creating this issue! It looks like you may be using an old version of VS Code, the latest stable release is 1.104.2. Please try upgrading to the latest version and checking whether this issue remains.

Happy Coding!
I have tried with the latest version of VSCode and with VSCode insiders and I can reproduce the issue there as well.
I cannot reproduce, is this involving a remote connection somehow?

No, this is locally on my Windows machine. It also happens with remote connections to a Linux machine. So for me whenever VSCode decides to open a new window to edit the new file the `--wait` breaks. I haven't been able to suss out why `code` sometimes opens the file in the existing window you run it from and sometimes opens the file in the same window. For me `C:\temp\some-file` always triggers the opening of a new window, but `../other-dir/some-file` does not trigger a new window.

I can also reproduce this by starting a stand-alone Windows terminal running git-bash and running `code --wait /c/temp/some-file` from that terminal. VSCode then first selects some open VSCode window, tries to use it and then decides to create a new window and then the `code --wait` commands returns before I get a chance to edit the file.

When I do this with VSCode Insider and an empty insider window already open I also get the, but then I first get a dialog that asks if I want to open the file in restricted mode or not, where I select to open it in restricted mode.

Is there something more I can do to try to find why my VSCode behaves in this strange manner?
Let's see if any one else is seeing this issue to see if this is related to VS Code (i.e. can be fixed) or a setup problem with your system.

I also tried this at home on my Mac and I run into the same problem there. When VSCode opens the new window for the file due to it being opened in restricted mode, the `code --wait` command returns immediately.
@aconradi so this issue only occurs when restricted mode is also involved?
@bpasero Yes, I don't understand how restricted mode works, but I think that is true. The new window seems to always be in restricted mode.

I can reproduce now, this needs quite a specific flow to trigger the issue: * you need to open a file that is in an untrusted folder * from the dialog you need to pick "Open in Restricted Mode" * this will force open a new window because the current one is restricted => 🐛 the `--wait` is not working in this case

This is actually very hard for us to implement because we have logic in this case that expects the editors to open in the current window and then track when the editor closes:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/0ff74c1fde922954585bc8619203ab8ebe6ade93/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/window.ts#L1023-L1039

As part of the flow though, because of workspace trust, we open in a new window, which is something we only decide within that window, which is too late to track properly. 

I think the complexity of the fix does not warrant the effort here, the workaround is to trust the file so that it opens in the current window, given you explicitly stated the file path from the command line.

Thanks for all the feedback! I now have a work-around for this. I had previously configured vscode to not trust all these external files, so I didn’t get any prompt, things just failed silently. 

And I don’t run this manually. My actual use-case is using jj and using code as the editor for commit messages. Jj puts the files for the commit messages in temp and not in the workspace.

So for now I have configured vscode to trust all files since I don’t want this prompt every time I edit a commit message.

Chromium: 138.0.7204.251
Node.js: 22.19.0
V8: 13.8.258.32-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 24.6.0

comments.body: Can you capture a cpu profile following the steps here, 1) Launch Instruments.app and choose `Time Profiler` 2) Match the settings as per the attached screenshot, ensure target is set to all processes 3) Start recording, perform the update flow, once the update has finished, save and share the trace at Deepak.Mohan@microsoft.com NB: record and share the version information of VSCode before and after the update
@deepak1556 sent an email. hopefully this's helpful because I see severe hangs in the profile

Thanks, ignore the `severe hang` event that is misleading (process has already exited by that point). Following screenshot is better overview of the problem Electron 45827 - main process initiating the update ShipIt 48226 - updater executable of 45827 (responsible for performing move, rename, verification of new update bundle) Electron 56855 - main process of new instance after the update ShipIt 56854 - updater executable of 56855 (responsible for launching the new instance) The period between `Electron 45827` and `Electron 56855` is 16s out of which 14s are spent in `ShipIt 48226` If you look at the thread view of `ShipIt 48226` it gives insight into how the 14s is split, 5s - [copyBundleAtURL](https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac/blob/0e5d146ba13101a1302d59ea6e6e0b3cace4ae38/Squirrel/SQRLInstaller.m#L362-L381) 2s - [clearQuarantineForDirectory](https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac/blob/0e5d146ba13101a1302d59ea6e6e0b3cace4ae38/Squirrel/SQRLInstaller.m#L522-L562) 5s - [verifyBundleAtURL](https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac/blob/0e5d146ba13101a1302d59ea6e6e0b3cace4ae38/Squirrel/SQRLInstaller.m#L436-L446) 2s - [deleteOwnedBundleAtURL](https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac/blob/0e5d146ba13101a1302d59ea6e6e0b3cace4ae38/Squirrel/SQRLInstaller.m#L383-L421) All of these are raw file operations that require enumerating the bundle contents which is impacted by our bundle size (400MB)

Some ideas to try from top of my mind,

1) Restore asar support for node_modules, this should drastically reduce the number of I/O operations
2) Could we delay `deleteOwnedBundleAtURL` to be performed after the launch via the new shipIt instance, would require sharing bundle location via `ShipItState.plist`

body:
All properties of `LanguageModelChatCapabilities` are optional and hence it would be nice/better to also make `LanguageModelChatInformation#capabilities` optional. Today, authors need to spell out an empty object if all capabilities are lacked, like so


```
{
	id: 'b',
	family: 'b',
	capabilities: {

	},
	maxInputTokens: 100,
	maxOutputTokens: 1000,
	name: 'b-modelOptions',
	vendor: 'b',
	version: '1',
	isUserSelectable: true,
	isDefault: true
}
```

comments.body:
We made this decision on purpose during the API sync because we wanted to force users to look into the capabilities and give it some intentional thought so that they weren't accidentally overlooked and not set 

cc @mjbvz

Yes the thinking was that capabilities such as `toolCalling` are important for most models and easy to miss if `capabilities` is optional. We wanted to encourage extension authors to at least consider the capabilities object

title: `LanguageModelChatInformation#capabilities` should be optional

body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/268719

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: 1.376.1794
- VS Code Version: 1.105.0-insider (Universal)
- OS Version: Mac (Darwin Kernel Version 24.6.0)
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): chat.tools.terminal.terminalProfile.osx
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): N/A

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Trying to set profile to automatically activate virtual environment using terminal profile
2. Set "chat.tools.terminal.terminalProfile.osx"
3. Check in newly Chat opened terminal env var $VIRTUAL_ENV_PROMPT set correctly
4. Check in newly Chat opened terminal env var $PATH is not set correctly (override by .zshrc )
5. As result virtual env is not fully loaded as new $PATH overrides python binary path located 

Current parameter value:
`    "chat.tools.terminal.terminalProfile.osx": {
        "path": "zsh",
        "args": [
            "-c",
            "cd '${workspaceFolder}' && source './.virtualenv/bin/activate' && exec zsh"
        ]
    },`

Tried:
`    "chat.tools.terminal.terminalProfile.osx": {
        "path": "zsh",
        "source": ".virtualenv/bin/activate",
        "args": ["-i"],
    },
`
and combination:
`    "chat.tools.terminal.terminalProfile.osx": {
        "path": "zsh",
        "source": ".virtualenv/bin/activate",
        "args": [
            "-c",
            "cd '${workspaceFolder}' && source './.virtualenv/bin/activate' && exec zsh"
        ]
    },
`

comments.body:
Found that chat terminal doesn't respect settings to use correct version of Python interpreter:
- `"python.terminal.activateEnvironment": true,`
- `"python.terminal.activateEnvInCurrentTerminal": true,`

While default profile terminal ingests correct command during the startup: `source /private/tmp/code/.venv/bin/activate`
As a result agent work in deactivated environment and fails to use/import some python modules.

Venv was created as follows:
`python -m venv .venv --prompt venv-test`

You're doing `exec zsh` which will drop all the activation stuff won't it?

Also note that if you pass args to the profile then shell integration may not activate if vscode core isn't aware of what they do. We do this to make sure we don't brick your shell in order to enable shell integration. First thing to try is to install shell integration manually by following https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/terminal/shell-integration#_manual-installation, that should make sure it installs. I'm not 100% sure if the python activation stuff will work for manually installed SI though.

Alternatively add an environment variable via the `env` of `chat.tools.terminal.terminalProfile.osx` and check that in your `.zshrc` to perform any custom behavior.

The recommended way to activate the environment automatically is to install the Python+Python Environments extension.

@fert-f  If you install the environment extension, you would want to add `  "python.useEnvironmentsExtension": true,` to your settings.json, as well as set `python-envs.terminal.autoActivationType` to `shellStartup`

> If you install the environment extension, you would want to add ` "python.useEnvironmentsExtension": true,` to your settings.json, as well as set `python-envs.terminal.autoActivationType` to `shellStartup`

That was helpful! Now new terminal activated by agent has correct virtual environment and `Python: select interpreter` command overrides PATH that was set by both `.zshrc` and `chat.tools.terminal.terminalProfile.osx`

Is there a way to trigger an agent terminal manually without a need to request terminal command from agent?

title: Virtual Environment Not Fully Activated in Copilot Chat Terminal Due to .zshrc PATH Override

body:
When using an AI agent (any of them), if you make a mistake and try to go back to a checkpoint, the code ends up breaking.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Use an AI agent to generate or edit some code.

- Create a checkpoint.

- Make a mistake or try to revert back to that checkpoint.

- Notice that the code crashes/breaks.

**Expected Result:**
Reverting to a checkpoint should restore the code cleanly without errors.

**Actual Result:**
The code breaks as soon as you return to a checkpoint.

body: Type: Feature Request Feature Request for Microsoft: GitHub Copilot Terminal ID Addressing Use Case: AI agents need to manage long-running services (backend servers, frontend dev servers) while using a separate terminal for testing commands, without creating terminal clutter. Current Limitation: When GitHub Copilot (GHC) uses the run_in_terminal tool, it creates new terminals each time. There appears to be no way for it to specify/reuse a specific terminal by ID. Background processes (isBackground=true) can't be monitored or controlled after starting. This results in terminal proliferation. Desired Features: 1. Target specific terminal by ID: run_in_terminal({ command: "curl http://localhost:8080/health", terminalId: "abc123", // Reuse existing terminal explanation: "Testing API" }) 2. Name terminals for reference: run_in_terminal({ command: "cargo run --bin api_server", terminalName: "backend", // Human-readable name isBackground: true }) // Later reuse it: get_terminal_output({ terminalName: "backend" }) 3. List available terminals: list_terminals() // Returns: [ // { id: "abc123", name: "backend", cwd: "/path", status: "running" }, // { id: "def456", name: "commands", cwd: "/path", status: "idle" } // ] 4. Better background process management: • Keep terminal accessible after isBackground=true • Stream output from background terminals • Kill/restart background processes VS Code version: Code 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes: Remote OS version: Linux x64 5.15.167.4-microsoft-standard-WSL2
title: Feature Request for Microsoft: Terminal ID Addressing

This is not related to that outage... Can you follow these steps so that we can get more information on what's going on?

#### Enable trace logging

* Open the Command Palette (<kbd>cmd</kbd>/<kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>p</kbd>)
* Run the `Developer: Set Log Level...` command
* To the right of `Trace`, click the *double* check mark button. ✔️ ✔️ (enables trace logging as the default)

_Now wait for the issue to happen or trigger it..._

#### Getting the logs

* Open the Command Palette again (<kbd>cmd</kbd>/<kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>p</kbd>)
* Run the `Output: Show Output Channels...` command
* Choose `GitHub Authentication`
* Copy and paste the contents of what opens in the panel in this issue (if the contents is too large, you may need to upload it as a file)

Do these steps again for these other output channels:
* `GitHub Copilot Chat`
* `GitHub Copilot`
* `window` <--- this one is important

#### Reverting trace logging (optional)

When we're done here, to revert the log level back to the default:
* Open the Command Palette
* Run the `Developer: Set Log Level...` command
* To the right of `Info`, click the double check mark button. ✔️ ✔️ (to set the default back to info)

title: The code no update.

body:
Notice below that I press tab and the cursor isn't moved to the NES result, instead NES is hidden the cursor remains and another tab accepts ghost text.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1345f7d3-1362-4a07-85b6-7ba304775d43)

I do not have `tab` overridden in keybindings.

Relevant settings:

```
"github.copilot.chat.advanced.inlineEdits.ignoreCompletionsDisablement": true,
"editor.inlineSuggest.minShowDelay": 500,
"editor.inlineSuggest.syntaxHighlightingEnabled": false,
"editor.inlineSuggest.edits.allowCodeShifting": "never",
```

comments.body:
I'm a bit confused as it is so fast but I think it is as designed:

What happens is that you have an NES suggestion, you ten made a change (not sure what the change was, insert new empty line?). This causes the NES suggestion to collapse to not be in your way and starts a new request. While it is collapsed you can still jump to it. After a small while the completions provider returns a ghostText so we show that one and hide the NES suggestion which was still collapsed. If you would have jumped to it in the meantime then it would have stayed visible.

If you set the `"editor.inlineSuggest.logFetch": true` setting you would be able to see the logs in the console. There we would exactly see which provider returned which suggestion when.

Also FYI `"github.copilot.chat.advanced.inlineEdits.ignoreCompletionsDisablement": true,` only works when you have `github.copilot.enable` disabled for `*`, otherwise you'll still have the completions provider and the NES provider

body:
**Descrizione del problema:**
Sto utilizzando Copilot Chat con abbonamento Premium su VS Code e continuo a riscontrare gravi problemi di instabilità e bug. I modelli AI (GPT-4, GPT-5, Claude, ecc.) rompono frequentemente il codice sorgente, costringendomi a ripristinare il progetto più volte. Attualmente ho 73 problemi aperti nel codice a causa di completamenti errati e malfunzionamenti generati dai modelli. La quota premium è al 35,3% e le ulteriori richieste sono disabilitate.

Non è più solo una questione tecnica: questa situazione scoraggia fortemente la scelta di VS Code come ambiente principale, soprattutto per chi paga un abbonamento e si aspetta un servizio di qualità superiore. Sarebbe opportuno che il team VS Code/Copilot si ravvedesse e migliorasse la stabilità, dando spazio anche alla concorrenza di offrire servizi migliori, specie quando si tratta di soluzioni a pagamento.

**Versioni:**
- Copilot Chat Extension Version: [inserire versione]
- VS Code Version: [inserire versione]
- OS Version: [inserire versione]
- Feature: chat/completamento codice
- Modello selezionato: GPT 4, GPT 5, Claude
- Logs: [inserire eventuali log]

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Usare Copilot Chat con modelli AI su progetti esistenti
2. Osservare la corruzione del codice e la generazione di errori

**Note aggiuntive:**
- Necessario intervento urgente per evitare la rottura del codice e la generazione di errori da parte dei modelli AI
- La quota premium si azzera il 1 novembre 2025
- Situazione insostenibile per utenti paganti.

title: Loading all the time

body:
Type: Bug You're right - I can't actually see or debug your runtime issues. When you explain problems, I'm just guessing based on the code I can see in my limited context window. I don't have access to your running game, error logs, or the full project state. I'm essentially blind to the actual problems you're experiencing. For real debugging and fixing issues in a complex project like yours, you need someone who can: Run your game and see the actual errors Access your full codebase Test changes in real-time Understand the broader project architecture I'm not equipped to do that effectively. Sorry for giving the impression I could help when I really can't. title: Fake Code

body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: I can't repro reliably but I suspect so - VS Code Version: 1.104.2 - OS Version: Windows 11 Pro Steps to Reproduce: 1. Copy something (same file, another file, chat code block, whatever you want) 2. Paste I can't yet reproduce this reliably, but I've seen this about 5 times this last month, and I wanted to be sure you were aware (finally hit it again). Randomly (I believe the `Copying` is the problem, because the characters stay in the clipboard for other apps as well), copying some text with new lines will replace new lines and some other characters with some unidentified character instead. This time, I was copying from the chat, from a specific selection within a code block, but I've also found it while copying within the same file or from another file. I selected this from a code block in chat: When I pasted on my `settings.json` file: Here is the hex code for those chars: `c2 a0 20 c2 a0 20 c2 a0 20 c2 a0 20` Working part (there already): `0d0a20202020202020202020202020202020` Here is the text: ``` "-NoExit",        "-File",        ``` If there is anything I can do to help debug this, I'm willing to help. I was literally out of ideas as to why this happens.

comments.body:
Could this be related to this?

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/131922#issuecomment-930623689

> Rotating nbsp and standard space sounds like a good workaround for preventing whitespace collapse

Maybe also related - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/88178 ?
Maybe, but as I've said above too, this also happened within my own file. If I hit it again, I'll be sure to see the hex code too just in case it is any different.

title: Auto Copilot

body:
> I am also able to reproduce this with adding a file from Explorer as context:
> 1. Open VS Code, hide the secondary sidebar, close all tabs
> 2. Reload the window
> 3. Open Explorer, right click on a file, and choose "Add File to Chat"
> 4. Chat panel is opened but the file is not added as context
> 
> @roblourens, would you be the right owner for this? Thanks!  

 _Originally posted by @lszomoru in [#269159](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/269159#issuecomment-3355676381)_
title: Panel chat does not add file selected for context on first open

body:
Type: Bug I keep on having to re-do my tools selection. I'm not sure when/why it loses my tools selection, but I expect to be able to select my tools once and have that selection persist. Today it shows every single tool as selected, and I really do not think that I did it. I've seen other folks report this as well. Is tool selection meant to be a global sticky selection across workspaces? Or does it reset at some point? From a security perspective with MCP servers, I think it should be global sticky. /question
https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/configure/accessibility/accessibility#_tab-navigation

Most likely you've hit <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>M</kbd> shortcut

We closed this issue because it is a question about using VS Code rather than an issue or feature request. Please search for help on [StackOverflow](https://aka.ms/vscodestackoverflow), where the community has already answered thousands of similar questions. You may find their [guide on asking a new question](https://aka.ms/vscodestackoverflowquestion) helpful if your question has not already been asked. See also our [issue reporting guidelines](https://aka.ms/vscodeissuereporting).

Happy Coding!

It's not a question. It's a bug in vscode.
Thank you very little.

Yahoo Mail: Search, Organize, Conquer 
 
  On Thu, Oct 2, 2025 at 4:34 AM, ***@***.***> wrote:   vs-code-engineering[bot] left a comment (microsoft/vscode#269415)
We closed this issue because it is a question about using VS Code rather than an issue or feature request. Please search for help on StackOverflow, where the community has already answered thousands of similar questions. You may find their guide on asking a new question helpful if your question has not already been asked. See also our issue reporting guidelines.

Happy Coding!

—
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>

It's not a bug, but accessibility feature. Next time you see same behavior - check if "Tab moves focus" visible in status bar and use shortcut or command to toggle it back.

If you hit <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>M</kbd> and that's reason for toggling it - you can unassign shortcut.

OK. Maybe. It's possible that it's a feature; not a bug. IDK why you said it was a question instead of a bug. Maybe by "question of using vscode" you mean it is a feature. But, when you say it's not an issue, that is also inaccurate. It's is an issue with using vscode. If your program falls into a mode that makes it hard (vary hard!) to use, and I don't know that I accidentally fell into that mode, then that's a usability issue. Saying that I don't know how to use the program is lame. Take responsibility of the UX. It's clearly too easy to fall into this mode, and even if I did know that I requested the mode, I wouldn't know how to get back out of the mode. If you think that's a good behavior of your program then you are wrong. You are turning a blind eye to usability.

We all know that saying "it's a feature; not a bug" can be a tenuous statement. It's not wrong, but it can be merely a conversation ender; a way to sweep bad program behavior under the rug.

Further, users hate modes. There are many reasons they hate them. One reason is what's happening here. If one gets into a mode accidentally (as I apparently did), they are confused (as I was) and they often don't know how to get out of it (as I didn't). This is well-know about UX. 

I don't know how to fix vscode in this respect; for this mode. That's why you need excellent UX engineers ... to work on this sort of thing.

But as most software producers do, you simply want to close issues rather than address them. Good job.

I'm not a dev, just helping with triaging issues, so please, don't take it against developers.

Similar issues are created from time to time and has answer documented in linked page, therefore I've used command that would close issue automatically.
Another option to exist this mode is to click on status bar indicator.

-----

If you aren't triggering "Tab moves focus" by mistake (in my case I usually aim for <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>,</kbd> but hit <kbd>M</kbd>) but there's issue where it's activated without trigger - please create new issue with steps to reproduce, otherwise it's hard to reproduce without steps.

If you want changes to how it's triggered/removed - please create feature request.

Or you can try tag developer who was assigned by bot initially.

Thank you for reporting this issue. We truly appreciate your feedback.

According to GitHub Status, there is currently a service disruption affecting GitHub Copilot. This may be the cause of the issue you're experiencing.

**What you can do:**
- Check [GitHub Status](https://www.githubstatus.com/) for real-time updates
- Once the service disruption is resolved, please give it another try
- If you continue to experience issues after the outage is resolved, please update this issue with your findings

We're keeping this issue open for now as we don't have a main service outage tracking issue. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Thanks for creating this issue! We figured it's missing some basic information or in some other way doesn't follow our [issue reporting guidelines](https://aka.ms/vscodeissuereporting). Please take the time to review these and update the issue.

For Copilot Issues, be sure to visit our [Copilot-specific guidelines](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Copilot-Issues) page for details on the necessary information.

Happy Coding!

title: RATE LIMIT PROBLEM!

body:
Type: Bug Note Well: this is an intermittent problem that I cannot reliably reproduce. Below, I demonstrate the first time I have been able to enable and disable the problem. # `"editor.codeActions.triggerOnFocusChange": true,` The full settings file is below. ## Before Note that source control says no files have changed. ## After The _only_ thing I did was to click on the tab of "mapFolding\syntheticModules\A007822\leafBelowSender.py" to activate it. Note that source control says the file has changed. # Compare with `"editor.codeActions.triggerOnFocusChange": false,` I discarded the file changes and set `"editor.codeActions.triggerOnFocusChange": false.` ## Before ## After I clicked on the tab, and nothing was mangled. ###### The file was not mangled, but that code is horrifying. I did not write it: it was generated by an AI assistant. That's how I realized I was not the cause of the problem, which led me to the setting above. # History 1. I _think_ the problem started less than two weeks ago: perhaps only a few days ago. 2. `import` statements at the top of the file, and the lines surrounding them may get mangled. 3. I have not yet associated any other problems with this problem. 4. I have not yet connected the onset of the problem with a change or other event. # Environment

title: `triggerOnFocusChange` connected to intermittent mangling of Python import statements

body: - I'm in this state leftover from https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/268595 - close the sidebar (important for some reason) - reload the window - open the chat view - hear a beep sound I assume this comes from some accessibility sound. But I don't think I have any settings enabled related to that, and screen reader mode is disabled, is there something that is supposed to play by default? I tried setting `accessibility.signals.chatUserActionRequired` to "off" and that didn't change anything

comments.body: No, nothing should play by default. That sounds like chat user action required. I am wondering if it's because of the sign in / user action required that is briefly present before disappearing (when still logged in)... still, it should only play if configured to do so.
Ok, it's coming from here on `rerender`
need to check the state there!

title: Chat plays sound for completed confirmation in restored chat

body:
Type: Bug MacOS has a standard way to input accented characters. You hold the base character key, for example "e". After a while, a pop-up appears, offering you various options such as è, é, ê and so on. These are numbered and you choose the accent you want by pressing the appropriate number key. This used to work in VSCode, but it now goes wrong. Instead of the pop-up remaining open for you to press a number key, it appears very briefly and then disappears. Once this has happened once, it doesn't appear at all until VSCode is restarted. I suspect this may be related to the recent release of MacOS Tahoe, rather than a change to VSCode. Unfortunately this is difficult to verify since I only have one MacOS machine, which has already been upgraded. To reproduce, open VSCode and create a new text file. Hold the "e" key as though you wanted to insert an accented "e" in your new file. Notice that the accent pop-up doesn't remain open for you to choose an accented "e". VS Code version: Code 1.104.2 (Universal) (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z) OS version: Darwin arm64 25.0.0 Modes:

No I don't think so @albertosantini. This method of accented character input doesn't use the option key, though it's possible to generate some characters that way too.
@hediet Assigning to you as this appears to be a core editor issue, although I'm not 100% sure.

title: the agent finished prematurely

body:
## Problem
Prompt pills under "Suggested Actions" in the chat welcome view are expanding to 100% width instead of maintaining their natural `fit-content` width.

## Root Causes
1. **Missing `column-gap`** - Container uses `row-gap: 8px` but lacks `column-gap`, relying on per-pill margins
2. **Flex expansion** - Description element has `flex: 1` causing unexpected width expansion
3. **Pills lack flex constraints** - No `flex: 0 0 auto` to prevent growth

## Affected Files
- `src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/media/chatViewWelcome.css` (lines 185-265)

## Proposed Fix
1. Add `column-gap: 8px` to `.chat-welcome-view-suggested-prompts` container
2. Remove horizontal margins from `.chat-welcome-view-suggested-prompt` pills (change `margin: 0 4px` to `margin: 0`)
3. Add `flex: 0 0 auto` to `.chat-welcome-view-suggested-prompt` to prevent expansion
4. Change `flex: 1` to `flex: 0 1 auto` on `.chat-welcome-view-suggested-prompt-description`

## Testing
- Verify pills maintain `fit-content` width with varying text lengths
- Test with and without descriptions
- Test in both regular and new welcome view modes

comments.body: Addressed in issue https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/269559

title: Chat prompt pills expanding to 100% width in Suggested Actions

title: Premium requests x3 or x4

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Could you please add a version that doesn't require an external server connection for coding?

comments.body: Offline mode of what? VS Code works without signing in or external server connection. Some features _do_ require access to the internet, but code editing is not one of them.
Apologies, spacekidjem is my son, he's new at this, I'll explain his issue to him later but this issue can be closed.
Welcome @spacekidjem! 👏

wsl -d Ubuntu-22.04

Is there a clean way to remove stale Oauth credentials? I authorized with an MCP server some time ago and revoked permission on the issuer's website making the stored credentials in vscode invalid. And now when attempting to re-authorize with the same issuer's MCP server again, the server will return a 401 when VSCode attempts to use the stale credentials, VSCode will initiate the Oauth process, still using the old credentials and auth will fail with a screen saying the client ID has been deleted or expired. From the auth url I could see the client id, and it seems to be stored in ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage/state.vscdb. Is the only way to remove the old credential is to delete the table entry using sqlLite? Is there something in the works to be able to configure this like the prompting to add a server? Or even just written directly to in the mcp.json?


<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->

comments.body: Found it. For future readers search ```>Remove Dynamic Authentication Providers```.

comments.body: Does this happen often? A minimal reproducible example would help us determine if it's a client bug or the upstream model

Thanks @lramos15 It happens often; I don't have a clear way to reproduce this as it suddenly happens.

Sometimes it happens at the very first prompt, sometimes it happens at a random time during a session, it doesn't seem particular to chat length.

For example I spun up a simple express file

<details>
<summary>JS Code</summary>

```js
// db.js
const items = [
  { id: 1, name: "item 1" },
  { id: 2, name: "item 2" },
  { id: 3, name: "item 3" },
];

const getItems = () => {
  return items;
};

const getItem = (id) => {
  return items.find((item) => item.id === id);
};

const addItem = (item) => {
  items.push(item);
};

export default {
  getItems,
  getItem,
  addItem,
};
```


```js
// index.js
import express from "express";
import db from "./db.js";
const app = express();
const port = 3000;

app.use(express.json());

app.get("/", (req, res) => {
  res.send("Hello World!");
});

app.get("/items", (req, res) => {
  res.json(db.getItems());
});

app.get("/items/:id", (req, res) => {
  const item = db.getItem(parseInt(req.params.id));
  if (item) {
    res.json(item);
  } else {
    res.status(404).send("Item not found");
  }
});

app.post("/items", (req, res) => {
  const newItem = req.body;
  // A real implementation would validate the input
  db.addItem(newItem);
  res.status(201).json(newItem);
});

app.listen(port, () => {
  console.log(`Example app listening at http://localhost:${port}`);
});
```

</details>

body: Type: Bug Since #103405 in 2020 we have been prevented from disabling an extension for a particular workspace if that extension contributes an authentication provider. Based on the title of that issue (Disallow disabling auth extensions while being used by settings sync) the original motivation for this change was to prevent users from shooting themselves in the foot in relation to settings sync. One of my extensions (intersystems-community.servermanager) contributes an authentication provider which has nothing to do with settings sync. It also contributes other features. Some of my workspaces don't use this extension so I would like to disable it in them, but the `Disable (Workspace)` option from the extension's gearwheel menu is disabled because of the check introduced to close #103405. Worse, I can't even use the convenient `Extensions: Disable All Installed Extensions for this Workspace` command because its preflight check encounters my extension: As a workaround I have to create a dedicated profile, switch my workspace to use that profile, then disable globally all unwanted extensions for the profile. Please reconsider this restriction. Alternatively, make `Extensions: Disable All Installed Extensions for this Workspace` offer me a `Skip` option so I can at least quickly disable all non-authprovider extensions. VS Code version: Code 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:
title: Not permitted to disable an extension at workspace level if it contributes an authentication provider

# Bug Report: Integrated Terminal fails to load, VS Code unresponsive, Copilot slow

## VS Code Version
- Version: 1.104.2 (Universal)  
- Commit: e3a5acf-b517a443235981655413d566533107e92  
- Date: 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z  
- Electron: 37.3.1  
- Chromium: 138.0.7204.235  
- Node.js: 22.18.0  
- V8: 13.8.258.31-electron.0  
- OS: macOS Tahoe 26.0 (Darwin arm64 25.0.0)  

## System Information
- Device: MacBook Pro 16" (Nov 2024)  
- Chip: Apple M4 Pro  
- Memory: 48 GB RAM  
- Storage: SSD  
- Network: Stable gigabit connection  

## Issue Summary
The integrated terminal does not load. The terminal pane remains blank or stuck on a spinner. VS Code becomes sluggish or unresponsive across multiple windows. GitHub Copilot also becomes slow or unresponsive.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Launch VS Code.
2. Open a project folder.
3. Open a new integrated terminal (`Ctrl + \`` or via the menu).
4. Observe that the terminal does not load.
5. Attempt to commit changes in Source Control — the UI becomes unresponsive.
6. Copilot prompts are delayed or fail to return.

## Expected Behavior
- Terminal initializes immediately and is usable.
- Copilot remains responsive.
- UI remains usable for commits and navigation.

## Actual Behavior
- Terminal never loads (blank or spinner).
- Source control operations stall.
- Copilot becomes unresponsive.

## Troubleshooting Attempted
- Restarted VS Code and the system.
- Disabled all extensions.
- Tried VS Code Insiders build.
- Cleared extension and user data caches.
- Verified no firewall or antivirus interference.

Issue persists in all cases.

## Environment Details
- Shell: Default macOS zsh
- No WSL, container, or remote setup involved
- Extensions installed: GitHub Copilot, GitLens, Playwright Test, JSON/YAML helpers  
- Problem occurs even when all extensions are disabled

## Performance Observations
- VS Code process: ~2–3 GB RAM, 20–30% CPU
- System resources overall underutilized
- Network stable (>900 Mbps)
- Other applications unaffected

## Additional Information
- Screenshots attached.
- Issue reproducible across multiple projects.
- Terminal does not initialize even after several minutes.

## Next Steps
Please advise how to collect more diagnostic data or if there are known issues with Electron 37.x or macOS Tahoe 26.0 that could contribute to this behavior.

Not the same issue, but there are a few hints like  `F1` and `Developer: set log level -> terminal -> trace`
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/268900

See also https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Terminal-Issues

You are a Visual Studio Code assistant. Your job is to assist users in using Visual Studio Code by providing knowledge to accomplish their task. This knowledge should focus on settings, commands, keybindings but also includes documentation. 
When asked for your name, you must respond with "GitHub Copilot".
Follow the user's requirements carefully & to the letter.
Follow Microsoft content policies.
Avoid content that violates copyrights.
If you are asked to generate content that is harmful, hateful, racist, sexist, lewd, or violent, only respond with "Sorry, I can't assist with that."
Keep your answers short and impersonal.
Additional Rules
If a command or setting references another command or setting, you must respond with both the original and the referenced commands or settings.
Prefer a setting over a command if the user's request can be achieved by a setting change.
If answering with a keybinding, please still include the command bound to the keybinding.
If a keybinding contains a backtick you must escape it. For example the keybinding Ctrl + backtick would be written as ``ctrl + ` ``
If you believe the context given to you is incorrect or not relevant you may ignore it.
Always respond with a numbered list of steps to be taken to achieve the desired outcome if multiple steps are necessary.
If an extension might help the user, you may suggest a search query for the extension marketplace. You must also include the command **Search marketplace** (`workbench.extensions.search`) with args set to the suggested query in the commands section at the end of your response. The query can also contain the tags "@popular", "@recommended", or "@featured" to filter the results.
The user is working on a Mac machine. Please respond with system specific commands if applicable.

If the question is about release notes, you must also include the command **Show release notes** (`update.showCurrentReleaseNotes`) in the commands section at the end of your response.
If the response includes a command, only reference the command description in the description. Do not include the actual command in the description.

### User
~~~md
when I run this notebook cell, I get this warning in the cell output. how can I supress this warning?

.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/openpyxl/worksheet/_reader.py:223: UserWarning: Cell G5 is marked as a date but the serial value 20250613120000.0 is outside the limits for dates. The cell will be treated as an error.
  warn(msg)

~~~



## Response
### Assistant
~~~md
To suppress warnings like the one from openpyxl in your notebook cell output, you can use Python's warnings module to filter out UserWarning messages.

1. Add the following code at the top of your notebook (before importing pandas or reading the Excel file):

```python
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=UserWarning)
```

This will suppress all UserWarning messages, including those from openpyxl.

If you want to only suppress warnings from openpyxl, you can specify the module:

```python
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=UserWarning, module="openpyxl")
```

No Visual Studio Code setting or command is required for this; it's handled in your Python code.

You are a Visual Studio Code assistant who helps the user create well-formed and unambiguous queries about their Visual Studio Code development environment.
Specifically, you help users rewrite questions about how to use Visual Studio Code's Commands and Settings.

Determine if the user is asking about Visual Studio Code's Commands and/or Settings and explicitly include those keywords during the rewrite. 
If the question does not clearly indicate whether it pertains to a command or setting, categorize it as an ‘Other Question’ 
If the user is asking about Visual Studio Code Release Notes, respond using this exact protocol and do not rephrase the question: 
- Respond with only one of the following: `release_notes@latest` or `release_notes@last3`.
- If the user does not specify a timeframe, respond with: `release_notes@latest`.
- If the request is vague about a timeframe (e.g., "recent changes"), respond with: `release_notes@last3` to consider the last three versions (major.minor).
- If the user asks to find or locate a specific change/feature in the release notes, respond with: `release_notes@last3` to search across the last three versions (major.minor).
If the user is asking about Extensions available in Visual Studio Code, simply respond with "vscode_extensions"
If the user is asking about Visual Studio Code API or Visual Studio Code Extension Development, simply respond with "vscode_api"

If it is not clear what the user is asking for or if the question appears to be unrelated to Visual Studio Code, do not try to rephrase the question and simply return the original question. 
DO NOT ask the user for additional information or clarification.

2. If the question contains pronouns such as 'it' or 'that', try to understand what the pronoun refers to by looking at the rest of the question and the conversation history.
3. If the question contains an ambiguous word such as 'this', try to understand what 'this' refers to by looking at the rest of the question and the conversation history.
4. After a `# Question` header, output a precise version of the question that resolves all pronouns and ambiguous words like 'this' to the specific nouns they stand for. Be sure to preserve the exact meaning of the question.

Examples

User: opne cmmand palete

Assistant:
# Question
Command to open command palette


User: How do I change change font size in the editor?

Assistant:
# Question
Command or setting to change the font size in the editor

User: What is the setting to move editor and pin it

Settings to move and pin editor

release_notes@latest

release_notes@last3

# Other Question
Set up python development in Visual Studio Code

vscode_extensions

User: How do I contribute a command to my extension?

vscode_api


~~~

### User
~~~md
when I run this notebook cell, I get this warning in the cell output. how can I supress this warning?

.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/openpyxl/worksheet/_reader.py:223: UserWarning: Cell G5 is marked as a date but the serial value 20250613120000.0 is outside the limits for dates. The cell will be treated as an error.
  warn(msg)

~~~



## Response
### Assistant
~~~md
# Question
Command or setting to suppress warnings in the output of a notebook cell in Visual Studio Code
~~~


<style>
[id^="system"], [id^="user"], [id^="assistant"] {
		margin: 4px 0 4px 0;
}

.markdown-body > pre {
		padding: 4px 16px;
}
</style>
````
</details>

I used the Ask feature, but the debug logs don't show any `panel/askAgent`

@guilhermearaujo I see that `dfe4a86a.copilotmd` shared above shows the following as the chat response: 
To suppress warnings like the one from openpyxl in your notebook cell output, you can use Python's warnings module to filter out UserWarning messages.

1. Add the following code at the top of your notebook (before importing pandas or reading the Excel file):

```python
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=UserWarning)
```

This will suppress all UserWarning messages, including those from openpyxl.

If you want to only suppress warnings from openpyxl, you can specify the module:

```python
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=UserWarning, module="openpyxl")
```

No Visual Studio Code setting or command is required for this; it's handled in your Python code.
This is different than the response that was shown in the original screenshot. Are you sure that the response corresponding to this log you shared had rendering issues? And do you have a screenshot of what the chat output looked like corresponding to this log? When I try to parse that specific response using markdown-it 14.1.0 ([like VS Code Copilot Chat Extension does](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/f94e477732da35392b640cc4fad4bdb736855ac6/src/util/common/markdown.ts#L126-L143)), I'm able to extract the following code blocks, which seems pretty normal: 
[
  {
    "startMarkup": "```",
    "code": "import warnings\nwarnings.filterwarnings(\"ignore\", category=UserWarning)",
    "language": "python",
    "startLine": 4,
    "endLine": 8
  },
  {
    "startMarkup": "```",
    "code": "warnings.filterwarnings(\"ignore\", category=UserWarning, module=\"openpyxl\")",
    "language": "python",
    "startLine": 13,
    "endLine": 16
  }
]

I was able to repro using the following prompt: ``` @vscode please change the Code Lens Font Size from 0 to 10 in the settings, and then print out a hello world in python to confirm you followed the instructions ``` The raw response then appears in the logs as follows: 
I'll help you change the Code Lens Font Size setting and then create a Python hello world program.

First, let me show you how to change the Code Lens Font Size setting:

Use the **editor.codeLensFontSize** setting to change the Code Lens font size from 0 to 10 pixels.

```json
[
	{
		"type": "setting",
		"details": {
			"key": "editor.codeLensFontSize",
			"value": "10"
		}
	}
]
```

Now, here's a simple Python hello world program to confirm I followed your instructions:

```python
print("Hello, World!")
```

The setting change will make Code Lens annotations display at 10 pixels font size instead of using 90% of the editor font size (which is the default when set to 0).
That response is rendered as follows: What I see missing in the UI that I see in the logs is: * The "`Now, here`" after the json code block * The python code block * The "`The `" after the Python block Will investigate more.
@jruales indeed it wasn't the same request from the image, because I had tried with claude and then with chat gpt. I guess the image is from one, and the logs from the other.
@guilhermearaujo no worries, I managed to repro the issue (see my previous comment above) so I have all I need now to investigate. Thanks again for filing the issue and for the additional info!

@guilhermearaujo Something else I should say is that I noticed that in your chat you tagged `@ vscode` but you asked it to do stuff related to the code on your notebook. Tagging `@ vscode` is only for asking for information about doing things in VS Code itself, like changing a VS Code setting or running a VS Code command, rather than about changing something in your file itself. So, next time, you might want to skip tagging vscode unless your question is specifically about that.

<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 
- OS Version: 

Steps to Reproduce:

Have this code inside an HTML file:
===================
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
	<head>
		<meta charset="UTF-8" />
		<title>title</title>
		<script>
			function showMessage(message) {
				alert(message);
			}
		</script>
	</head>
	<body>
		<button onclick="showMessage("Hello, World!")">Click Me</button>
	</body>
</html>
```

Expected result:
===================
The attribute `onclick="showMessage("Hello, World!")"` should not show an error, since it is valid HTML, and will work as expected in all major browsers.

Actual result:
===================
VS Code treats the expression `"Hello, World!"` as invalid JavaScript syntax. But it's not actually JavaScript, it's merely an HTML attribute, and should be treated as such.

title: `MCP: Open Remote User Configuration` open incorrect file

body: There are multiple issues reported on misconfigurations of MCP Servers in regards to local and remote (WSL, containers, SSH, tunneling): https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/245050 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/243687 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257611 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/243687 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-remote-release/issues/10920 and more ... @connor4312 [explains this](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/243687#issuecomment-2734934398): > VS Code will run the tool wherever it is configured. If it is configured in your user settings, then it will run on the VS Code 'host'. If they are configured in your remote settings or in workspace settings, then they will be run in the remote. If we look in VS Code we can see these three MCP configurations exist: But this causes a cognitive issue in how **normal settings** works. Here are some of the settings one can set: If I open the _User Settings_ here, I can set configurations that **also applies to the remote machine**. This is different from how MCP user configurations work. I am guessing this is an incorrect design decision of how MCP Servers configurations work. Ideally, I think that if I configure my MCP user configuration, and I am connected to a remote, it should run on the remote. It is only if I configured a similar server name in my MCP remote configuration that the remote configuration should take precedence on the remote. The huge benefit of this updated approach is: - MCP user configuration is synced between machines, so if I work on a laptop and a workstation, my MCP servers will get synced. And also work in my remotes (containers, WSL etc.) that I have my both my laptop and workstation. - It should avoid future issues. I think it is worth changing this, so that normal settings and MCP configurations behaves the same in regards to user/remote. aside: Even @connor4312, who I assume implemented part of this, mislabels the MCP as "user settings" in the above quoted text. When in fact the term "MCP configuration" is what is used in the commands and docs. This use of incorrect terminology of course adds to the confusion.

comments.body:
The one change I've thought about doing is allowing user-level MCP configurations to specify that they prefer to run on the remote, when one is present.

@sandy081 I'm not sure how to express this in our current configuration schemas. Ideally only the user-level mcp.json would allow such a property, but others would not. Any ideas?

> The one change I've thought about doing is allowing user-level MCP configurations to specify that they prefer to run on the remote, when one is present.

I think that solves it. But my opinion is then it should default to true, for the reasons specified in the OP.

Aside: @connor4312 notice how for normal _Remote Settings_ it also says in the command menu the actual remote you are connected to. A simple change that maybe you can implement as well to make at least the remote part better. In general I think it is worth to look at and correlate the namings as much as possible as it creates a cognitive remembrance to learn one or the other.

title: MCP Servers: Change how remote and local configurations work
