body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No - VS Code Version: N/A - OS Version: N/A Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to `https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/` check published branches. 2. `standalone/0.52` is the latest published branch, whereas `https://github.com/microsoft/monaco-editor/` has been updated to v0.53 3. Also, [vscodeRef](https://github.com/microsoft/monaco-editor/blob/main/package.json#L4) in monaco-editor repository points to a very recent version of vscode, but the [changelog](https://github.com/microsoft/monaco-editor/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#0530) for v0.53 shows very limited set of features added. Have there been any changes to [this](https://github.com/microsoft/monaco-editor/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#source-code-structure) source code structure?

comments.body: This is as expected. In the past we only created monaco-editor branches in the vscode repo when we needed to do a bug fix release.

Hi @hediet thank you for the clarification. Previously, when building our custom `monaco-editor-core` package, we would checkout to the standalone branch and execute the build steps from there. Based on your explanation, it appears we can checkout to the [vscodeRef](https://github.com/microsoft/monaco-editor/blob/main/package.json#L4) commit on VSCode's main branch, then build and publish the `out-monaco-editor-core` directory to obtain a compatible version for monaco-editor v0.53.

> it appears we can checkout to the [vscodeRef](https://github.com/microsoft/monaco-editor/blob/main/package.json#L4) commit on VSCode's main branch,

yes! That is also much more reliable.

body: Testing #268976 When cancelling the GitHub MCP servers ask to sign in with GitHub I am left with this: There is a server icon on the left and the warning icon on the right. Both seem to have the same hover though. I have to say this UI is both confusing and looks partially broken. //cc @mrleemurray @hawkticehurst @joaomoreno @isidorn

comments.body:
Yeah this is a really confusing bit of UI that I'd like to update. I believe this actually just one singular button where server icon button is the "root" and the red warning icon is an informational secondary state associated with the server icon button.

It's also why you get the half pill shape –– it's one half of a button, where the other half has a transparent background by default.

cc @unthinkmedia who's been working on some designs for the bottom bar of the chat input.
But is there any reason why its 2 icons and not just 1 icon with a warning overlay like we do for tools?

Is it possible to get all the possible errors/warnings that a person might get when in the prompt?  I was having a tough time recreating them?  There is this one and the one that shows up on the tool when you have too many tools activated.  Any others? I know there is one that show a blue refresh icon, is that still necessary?
The easiest way is to configure a local MCP server with a command that doesn't exist

I have a solution that I will share with the team next week that attempts to resolve this issue by create a single indicator that all warning derive from in the chat area. It currently feels inconsistent.

title: Half pill shaped warning for MCP unclear to me

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.32.2025093001
- VS Code Version:
```
Version: 1.105.0-insider (user setup)
Commit: 9f2fcb675abc6f6de54c325ac7ec42d0a42b8326
Date: 2025-09-30T05:02:26.169Z
Electron: 37.5.1
ElectronBuildId: 12409799
Chromium: 138.0.7204.251
Node.js: 22.19.0
V8: 13.8.258.32-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100
```
- OS Version: Windows 11
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Any
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): `Copilot SWE`

When I use GitHub Copilot Chat release version, then `Copilot SWE` model is available all the time, but once I switch to pre-release version it disappears when I reload or close and open again VSCode.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install GitHub Copilot Chat (release version)
2. Check that `Copilot SWE` model is available
3. Switch to pre-release version
4. Reload VSCode
5. `Copilot SWE` model is not available

I'm not sure if coincidence or it's intentionally, but in pre-release version of GitHub Copilot Chat, the `Copilot SWE` model is not available,

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/871964e1-3118-4e26-9a84-13bd4715909d

comments.body: Same here. I was using it with a previous version. After updating to Version 1.105.0-insider, the Copilot SWE models are gone.

Same as well.  What's odd is that I have VSCode on two different machines - both on the latest insiders edition (1.105, with date 2025-0930T05:02:26).  One is my home computer where SWE Agent is listed, the other is my work laptop which does not have it listed.  I'm logged in to GH with the same account (personal, not Enterprise-managed), same profile (installed plugins, etc)

I do see this error in the Output logs (extension host):
```
 [error] Error: chatParticipant must be declared in package.json: copilot-swe-agent
    at Kzt.$registerAgent (vscode-file://vscode-app/c:/PATH_REMOVED/Microsoft%20VS%20Code%20Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.desktop.main.js:509:5906)
```
Not sure if that's related or due to a plugin - I see the same error message for a 'claude-code'.  

FWIW I've never seen SWE Agent show up in the list on the laptop.

Hi folks, apologies for the confusion here and we appreciate this report. We're doing a gradual roll-out on Insiders/pre-release and it seems that some of your machines are in the control group where the model isn't available. So once you install the pre-release version, it disappears. We'll look into how we can address this, but in the mean time you can still access it by using the stable version or by disabling experiments in Insiders via the `workbench.enableExperiments` setting

Thank you for checking it out.

I have reinstalled GitHub Copilot Chat, now it shows that `0.31.3` version is installed (which as far as I understand, is the same as the stable one) and Copilot SWE model is available.
But once I manually install the newest version (`0.32.2025093001`), then Copilot SWE model is not available, and unfortunately disabling `workbench.enableExperiments` does not fix it for me (just informing).

<hr>

A new version of VSCode Insiders has been released and after updating it, GitHub Copilot Chat has been also updated to `0.32.2025100101` version and Copilot SWE model disappeared again.

title: Copilot SWE model is not available in GitHub Copilot Chat pre-release version

body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. fresh setup
2. open `vscode` folder
3. engage with chat

=> 🐛 it takes a very long time until the sign in dialog shows

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f7e629d4-a790-4eb1-a237-2479cc55423b)

comments.body: Maybe related to trying to discover `agent.md` files, @aeschli to confirm
To be fair, `chat.useNestedAgentsMdFiles` is not enabled, so its something else.
I can repro this for the `vscode` repo but not for any of our other folders. Checking to see where the slow down is.

I removed the mcp.json config defined here https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/.vscode/mcp.json and the setup dialog delay no longer shows up. The delay in the setup dialog being shown is because the setupAgent invocation is being delayed due to mcp server discovery and start. 
cc: @connor4312
As discussed: rather than blocking the transition from sending the chat input to the response, I would have expected this to be done as part of the "Working..." response.

title: Error

body:
Tasks ends up holding on to terminal instances indefinitely, leaking a bunch of memory.

Examples:

This listener is disposed if the terminal is disposed, but a reference to it is kept indefinitely as it's not deleted via `this._store.delete`:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/50e37a458d877100ed90fe48f0319b88a8effd5a/src/vs/workbench/contrib/tasks/browser/terminalTaskSystem.ts#L1566-L1569

This type of thing happens in several places where the terminal is registered against `TerminalTaskSystem` but never released:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/50e37a458d877100ed90fe48f0319b88a8effd5a/src/vs/workbench/contrib/tasks/browser/terminalTaskSystem.ts#L1410

Needs a proper audit by capturing heap snapshots to chase down all the leaks.

title: Tasks leaks terminals

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Some VSCode themes override the theme colors. When this happens, the `default` option produces an ugly black border line instead of the theme color. Before fixing these issues, `default` should not be used as the default option. Setting the default value to `system` or any previous value is acceptable and will not bother users. It is unwise to use an unstable option as the default.

comments.body:
@Jy-EggRoll but if a theme decides to set a `window.border`, VS Code should support that? It always has until we had to remove it when we introduced window control overlays.

Can you clarify why the color does not appear properly and how?

Alright, thank you for your response. I will provide more details immediately.

Using the Catppuccin theme and its custom theme colors, activating the VSCode window multiple times always reproduces:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/421576ed-c507-44d6-84b0-c3188c2a7fb0)

It can be seen that this is a black line border that severely affects visual coordination and doesn't fit in.

When this situation occurs, my settings are:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06cbc231-6db2-42fb-9b4c-eb3d97f8511b)

When I change it to `system`, this issue immediately disappears, and it becomes good as before.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6fc3d74e-7325-4ba7-a260-7efeb7f189ed)

Personal guess: The setting attempts to retrieve the theme color, but due to the reasons of third-party themes, the adaptability is poor, it retrieves the wrong color value and does not correctly fallback to the system value. Considering the best compatibility, it should prioritize `system` as the default value, and for users who need it, provide options like `follow-theme` and others.
Here is my Catppuccin settings:
@Jy-EggRoll can you figure out what border color exactly this theme tries to set?

> [@Jy-EggRoll](https://github.com/Jy-EggRoll) can you figure out what border color exactly this theme tries to set?

This theme completely **does not** set the border color. It hasn't done anything to the border color, but this result still appeared.
This is something the extension needs to fix.

This issue is caused by an extension, please file it with the repository (or contact) the extension has linked in its overview in VS Code or the [marketplace](https://aka.ms/vscodemarketplace) for VS Code. See also our [issue reporting guidelines](https://aka.ms/vscodeissuereporting). If you don't know which extension is causing the problem, you can run `Help: Start extension bisect` from the command palette (F1) to help identify the problem extension.

Happy Coding!
Okay, I apologize for my oversight earlier, and I will report this to the plugin.

title: MCP Disconnect

body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: - VS Code Version: 1.105.0-insider (Universal) - Commit: d8c3a3263dc798075cdb0104e113df049f2eaf7c - OS Version: Darwin arm64 24.6.0 - Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): agent - Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): Claude Sonnet 4.5 `healStringReplace` and `healApplyPatch`, when successfully correcting the target snippet, tends to result in bad edits. ## Example ### `replace_string_in_file` The following `replace_string_in_file` was issued by Claude Sonnet 4.5. ### `healStringReplace` It resulted in a `healStringReplace` tool call which provided the following `corrected_target_snippet`. ### Result The edit was placed at the first ` exit 1\n}` in this file, then Claude continued on to other tasks that it was completing without any information about how the edit landed in the file. Instead, the tool call just returned with `The following files were successfully edited:...` due to `healStringReplace` making the edit into the file. When this happens where an edit is placed into the wrong place in the file, I'll also experience cascading edit failures that can then lead to more healStringReplace calls, that have a chance at succeeding (since Claude Sonnet 4.5 just came out I should preface this with that I would see these cascading edit failures and healStringReplace calls from Claude Sonnet 4 most recently). ## Steps to Repro Steps to repro are essentially, work in a file with a Claude model until you get a `healReplaceString` call that successfully places the edit into the wrong place. This happens more often when you're working in an `` that has been summarized and has `isSummarization = true`, or if you're working in a file that has duplicate same lines, causing the `oldString` to match to multiple locations in a file. You're more likely to experience this as a user if you're working in a larger code file, a markdown file, a script file (such as powershell or bash), and really any code file where code could have been copied and pasted in a couple places in the file or the same set of function/method calls are made multiple times in a file.

comments.body: As an example, `healApplyPatch` causes `apply_patch` to return a message `There was an error applying your original patch, and it was modified to the following:` Which, `healStringReplace` does not seem to do the same thing with `replace_string_in_file`. This message seems to help gpt-5-codex at least correct some mistakes... `healApplyPatch` ultimately mistakenly made this edit: And then also removed my frontmatter: GPT-5-Codex managed to put it back to normal though.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/6c21f75cde7c2b53d20f0f1f01ee2f190fd78093/src/vs/workbench/contrib/tasks/browser/abstractTaskService.ts#L2622

title: Avoid console.warn in tasks

body:
This part of ITerminalService is only used by tasks: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/761fbb0ee2c430963e335a2c04113bf276f898d2/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminal/browser/terminalService.ts#L105-L108

It should move into tasks via an event instead of being a persistent API. There may also be a leak here since referenced to the terminal instances are held onto.

comments.body: Memory leak: 1. Run a single task 2. Reload the window, the task should get reconnected 3. Kill the task 4. Open devtools 5. Do a memory profile 6. Search for TerminalInstance, 🐛 there should be none as it was killed
No verify needed, the leak still exists after https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/269007 due to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/269006

body:

Just use the gpt-5-codex model and share your impressions with me. You can do some dedicated testing for this item or you can just use it as you go about your other test tasks. 

I just stopped an experiment that was changing the prompt. Please double-check that you have `"github.copilot.chat.gpt5CodexAlternatePrompt": "codex"`, this is the good prompt.

You could comment on
- The general behavior and intelligence
- Do you like the text responses that you get
- Is it editing accurately? Any unexpected issues with editing?
- An issue I've come across is that sometimes it doesn't want to use tools when it can run a terminal command instead- eg for running unit tests or build tasks, so pay attention to that as well
- Do you ever see it stop early with no text response?
- Any other error messages, glitches, etc

Please share a log if you have any issues

body:
Refs: #264520 

- [x] anyOS @Yoyokrazy 
- [x] anyOS @kieferrm 
- [x] anyOS @eleanorjboyd 

Complexity: 3

cc: @digitarald @jo-oikawa 


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268985%0A%0A&assignees=bhavyaus)

---

This TPI verifies that the experimental Chat Todo widget UX appears near the chat input.

### Setup
Ensure that you have the todo widget position set to `chat-input` (default is set to be at the top of the chat panel): 
`"chat.todoListWidget.position": chat-input` 

### Steps

- In Chat, request a complex development task which requires planning to trigger the todo tool usage. 
- You can also trigger the tool explicitly with the `#todo` invocation. 
- Use sample scenarios from [microsoft/vscode-copilot#11794](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot/issues/11794) as references.

Verify that the todo widget is surfaced at the top of the chat-input (above the files changes for the session)

#### Widget Basics
1. Verify that the todo tool title displays the current in-progress task.  
   - If no todos have been started, it should show `Todos (0/y)`.  
2. Verify that the widget can be expanded and collapsed.  
3. Ask the model for a short todo list of fewer than 3 items.  
   - Verify that the widget is not displayed in this case (short lists are not shown).  

#### Interaction & Metadata
Verify that hovering over a todo item displays its additional description as metadata.  

#### Clear Button Behavior
Verify that the **Clear** button is focusable and operable via keyboard.  
   - The button’s title and `aria-label` should both be **“Clear all todos”**.  
Verify that clicking **Clear** empties only the current session’s todos and hides the widget.  
   - Other sessions should remain unaffected.  

#### Dynamic Updates
With the widget expanded, verify that the list auto-scrolls as new items are started.  
With the widget collapsed, verify that the title updates to reflect the current in-progress item as the task progresses.

Complexity: 4



[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268983%0A%0A&assignees=joshspicer)

---

This TPI is to validate incremental change to the 'chat sessions' API and the overall GitHub copilot coding agent experience.


## Prerequisites

1. VS Code Insiders
1. **Pre-release GitHub Pull Requests** Extension
1. The following settings (should already be enabled for you):
     - `chat.agentSessionsViewLocation: "view"`
     - `githubPullRequests.codingAgent.uiIntegration: true`

Ensure that your workspace repository has [Copilot coding agent enabled](https://github.com/settings/copilot/coding_agent) (Microsoft repos have it enabled).

Optional: Claude Code installed locally and enabled with [`"github.copilot.chat.advanced.claudeCode.enabled": true`](https://vscodeteam.slack.com/archives/C05BHT75R6G/p1756098722078869) (see [last month's TPI](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/264419))

## Steps

Try to use coding agent for real-world tasks you need to accomplish.  We have made several improvements to the end-to-end experience for VS Code development (eg: adding [`copilot-setup-steps`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/.github/workflows/copilot-setup-steps.yml)). Feedback on how "ready" coding agent is for real coding tasks is valuable.


1. Open a workspace (like `microsoft/vscode`) where you'd like coding agent to work
1. Try a coding agent entrypoint, i.e
   a. From the sidebar chat (try building up context in Ask/Plan mode before hitting the cloud button.
   b. From the 'Chat sessions' view, hitting the `+` button
1. Report back on the overall experience, flow, and quality of resulting PR

comments.body: I don't see a way to send the sidebar chat to Claude Code, is this missing?

## Really Liked
- Screenshots with proof of fix
- Format of the PR description (VERY easy to grok)
  - Problem
  - Solution
  - Changes
  - Result
  - Additional benefits (could be omitted, but it actually let me know of some extra features that are now supported because of a package import)
- PR created was the minimal change that was suggested

## Didn't like
- ~~While it did show me a dialogue stating "this will continue from the coding agent." which I confirmed with "Don't ask me again", the chat history did not reflect this. There's currently a lot of friction here, which I reported in my issues~~ It actually does this

Had a few PR's go out on small repos I have.

Overall:
- Love that I have a page that I can see what the agent is going
- I feel like a page is "too much". I found myself pinning the page and leaving it off to the side, checking only when I had a moment to see if it was done. At that point I kind of just wanted it to sit in an extension, but somewhere I could easily. I see now that "Chat sessions" does this, so I'll use that in the future.

labels.name: chat-ext-issue
labels.description: Triaging assistance tag. Automatically applied if an issue comes from the chat oss repo.

title: @bug

body: Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/258443 - [x] anyOS @bpasero - [x] anyOS @cwebster-99 Complexity: 3 [Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268976%0A%0A&assignees=connor4312) --- This iteration we turned on MCP autostart by default (new MCP servers will start automatically when submitting your first chat request). However, we don't want to spam the user with various requests for input and so we guard this behind a notification that looks like 1. Have several MCP servers defined that need different types of input. E.g. Github MCP that requires auth and another server that requires [input](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/customization/mcp-servers#_input-variables-for-sensitive-data) 2. Verify you see that message when you first send it in chat (once per chat session) 3. Verify that "start it now" works as you would expect 4. Verify that other MCP servers that don't require input are started and that their tools are available on the first request

comments.body: I wonder if the MCP stuff needs to stand out a tad bit more, like a chat confirmation widget that has a border, @mrleemurray @hawkticehurst fyi, but maybe this was discussed before.

@connor4312 I had a bit of a hard time to get this to show reliably when I was in the same session where I added the MCP server. It then worked after window reload, I wonder if there is some condition that makes it only work after a restart once I added a MCP server?

> I wonder if the MCP stuff needs to stand out a tad bit more, like a chat confirmation widget that has a border, @mrleemurray @hawkticehurst fyi, but maybe this was discussed before.

In the same vein, I found when the chat response is long, this notification gets lost at the top. Something that is more prominent or sticky might be more effective here.

> I wonder if there is some condition that makes it only work after a restart once I added a MCP server?

Once the MCP is started successfully, we cache its tools and don't need to start it again. THis can be reset with the `MCP: Reset Cached Tools` command
@connor4312 no, the MCP server was not running right after I added it.
@cwebster-99 that is a great callout - @jo-oikawa do you have any recommendations?

title: Test: MCP server autostart + inputs

body: Type: Feature Request To save this conversation: In VS Code: Go to the chat panel where this conversation is Look for export/save options (usually a menu or button) Or copy all the text and paste into a new file Manual method: Select all the conversation text Copy it (Ctrl+C) Create a new file in VS Code Paste the conversation Save it as something like copilot_failure_conversation.txt For sharing: You can also take screenshots of key parts Or copy specific sections that show the problems This conversation is a good example of what NOT to do when providing technical support, and it might help others identify when they're getting bad AI assistance. The conversation clearly shows the pattern of: Making assumptions instead of asking for facts Using incorrect information Going in circles instead of systematic problem-solving Contributing to user frustration rather than resolving issues Extension version: 0.31.3 VS Code version: Code 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045 Modes:

Happy Coding!
what more do you need?

2mths ago tryed out your servce to fix a stepper motor issuse in my cfg file your ai made some simple ajustments here i am paying a monthly subscripsion to get my printer back to how it was but because of your coding agents had some how wiped the only working cfg file i had and before you say it yes that was silly not to have a back up but it does not stop there all my klipper file some how got wiped too so all i need is someone to put it wright i should have to be paying for somthing that i did not break hopfully that enogh info or you could look up my sessions and see for your selfs thanks.

<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 
- OS Version: 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. send a message in chat that'd take a little bit of time to complete
2. while agent is churning away, click on the message
3. 🐛 execution has been cancelled

I think this is a bug because I accidentally clicked on the message and hit ESC to undo my action... only to find that that had cancelled my request. I'm glad I caught it because I almost didn't realize that happened. I would expect the message to only be cancelled when a request is sent (aka ENTER).

comments.body:
this was actually intentional, but thinking back, i think this makes sense.

i'll revert it back next release (original PR herre: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/262844/files)

body:
<!--
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
!!                                WARNING                                     !!
!!                                                                            !!
!! DO NOT COPY/PASTE THIS TEMPLATE TO CREATE AN ENDGAME PLAN MANUALLY.        !!
!! Instead, use https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/duties/endgame to create  !!
!! the endgame plan automatically.                                            !!
!! For more information check                                                 !!
!! https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Running-the-Endgame               !!
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
-->

**Sometimes we have slight adjustments to the endgame plan to account for local holidays. Please update your endgame plan accordingly.**

- *September/29* Code freeze for the endgame
- *September/30* [Endgame starts](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#inside-an-iteration)
- *October/3* Endgame done
- *October/9* Expected release date (this may change)

##### Monday

- [x] Pin endgame issue on GitHub **@mjbvz**
- [x] Assess public holidays and adjust the endgame plan accordingly to ensure that announcements are made when the team can respond to them. **@mjbvz**
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-build-tools/tree/main/distro-tools) **@mjbvz**
- [x] Update links in the [Endgame notebooks](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/.vscode/notebooks/endgame.github-issues) to point to new milestone **@mjbvz**
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT, PRs should no longer be accepted to ensure a green build
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms at 5pm PT
- [x] [🔖Ensure all closed feature-requests](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20label%3Afeature-request%20-label%3Averification-needed%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3A*out-of-scope) either have a `verification-needed` or `on-testplan` label
- [x] Create test plan items following the template [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Writing-Test-Plan-Items) by 6pm PT
  - [x] Remind the team that TPIs should be written so that anyone can test. If this is not feasible, then TPI authors should assign specific testers **@mjbvz**
- [x] Update your availability for testing here - https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/team-manifest **team**
  - [x] Double check N/A testers. **@mjbvz**
  - [x] Remind team that in the event of sickness or overload with TPIs, to inform the endgame champ ASAP so items can be reassigned
- [x] Remind team to go through their fixed issues for the milestone and update repro steps for issues which require more detailed instructions.
- [x] Set up the endgame retrospective to discuss process improvement
  - Schedule an endgame restrospective with @mjbvz, endgame buddy, and next @mjbvz for late debt week
  - [Create the endgame retrospective tracking issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/issues/new?template=endgame-retrospective.md)
- [x] Set up a standup meeting for Friday to discuss candidates

##### Tuesday

- [x] Test plan items assigned (using https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/test-plan-items)
  - Run the tool multiple times to balance load if test items come in later and assignments are already made
  - [Assigned to you](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+assignee%3A%40me++label%3Atestplan-item+)
- [x] Test build starts at 7am CET
- [x] Test plan ready by 8am CET
- [x] Remind the team about the priorities
  - Tuesday should be dedicated _exclusively_ to testing activities. Our goal is to ensure the completion of all Test Plan Items (TPIs) and subsequently proceed with the verification phase. Fixes or commits should be refrained from unless there are exceptional circumstances such as blocked TPIs or build-related issues. On Tuesday Redmond EOD, only blocked TPIs should remain open with a corresponding label `blocked` and status update comment in the issue.
- [x] Testing and Verification 
  - [x] [🔖Testing](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20label%3Atestplan-item)
  - [x] [🔖Verification of Bugs Reported by me](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20author%3A%40me%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
  - [x] [🔖Verification needed](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20label%3Averification-needed)
  - [x] [🔖Verification](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug) (If verification needed is finished)


##### Wednesday

- [x] [🔖Testing](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20label%3Atestplan-item)
  - These remaining TPIs should be the ones that are currently blocked. Discuss during the standup and redistribute assignments based on the TPI owner and the test coverage. For instance, if a TPI is owned by a member from Zurich and has not undergone sufficient testing, it will be reassigned to one of the Zurich team members.
- [x] Remind team members to triage issues found in testing and assign major issues that they intend to fix to the current milestone. Remind team to move out or close other open issues/PRs on the milestone that they do not intend to fix this milestone.
- [x] [🔖Verification needed](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20label%3Averification-needed)
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [🔖Verification](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
- [x] Message team members as needed to add steps to `verification-steps-needed` issues **@mjbvz**

##### Thursday

- [x] Make sure the `insider` build is green **@mjbvz**
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
  - Increased scrutiny sets in due to testing being completed. Fixes pose a much higher risk
  - Move open issues/PRs to the next month that can be deferred
- [x] Emphasize to the team that we want to verify as many issues as we can before the branching time, and ping team members as needed to remind them to add steps to `verification-steps-needed` issues  **@mjbvz**
- [x] [🔖Verification needed](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20label%3Averification-needed)
- [x] [🔖Verification](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
- [x] Fix any issues regarding new undocumented colors. **@mjbvz**
  - [x] In the vscode-docs repo, merge the `main` branch into `vnext`
  - [x] Run `scripts/test-documentation.sh|bat` after compiling the vscode repo, and fix any issues regarding new undocumented colors. Changes made to the vscode-docs repository must be pushed to the vnext branch of vscode-docs repository for the script to acknowledge them. False positives within the `color` section in `vscode-known-variables.json` can be moved under the `others` section of that file.
- [x] Ensure [Copilot Chat CG](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_componentGovernance/207009) is happy **@mjbvz**
- [x] Ensure the [Copilot Chat CI / Build](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=500) is green **@mjbvz**

##### Thursday/Friday - Depending on @mjbvz timezone

- [x] Make sure the `insider` build is green **@mjbvz**
- [x] By Thursday EOD (Redmond) or Friday BOD (Zurich), branch from `main` and release **@mjbvz**
  - [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-build-tools/tree/main/distro-tools) once again from `main` to ensure picking up any dependency license changes **@mjbvz**
  - [x] [Disable continuous `insider` builds](https://builds.code.visualstudio.com/builds/insider) and announce in `#release`
  - [x] Branch following repositories to `release/<x.y>`.
    - [x] vscode
    - [x] vscode-distro
    - [x] vscode-dev
  - [x] Bump up the version in `package.json` on `main` & run `npm i` to bump `package-lock.json` as well. **@mjbvz**
  - [x] Branch `vscode-copilot-chat` **@mjbvz**
    - [x] Create new release branch with format `release/<version>` where `<version>` is `0.X` from `package.json`
    - [x] Bump the minor version number in `main` to the next monthly version (bump `X` in `0.X.0`), run `npm install` to update `package-lock.json`
  - [x] Announce `main` is open for business, and all issues on the current iteration should now be candidates that need to follow the candidate release process.
  - [x] Localization: Run [Update VS Code Branch](https://monacotools.visualstudio.com/Monaco/_build?definitionId=369) build with `release/*` as the VS Code Branch parameter (it's the default so you shouldn't have to change anything)
  - [x] Trigger the [⭐️ VS Code](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=111) pipeline from `release/<x.y>`, with the `insiders` Quality and enable `Release build if successful`.
  - [x] Trigger the [[vscode.dev] 🚀 Deploy](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=276) pipeline from `release/<x.y>`, with the `insiders` Deployment Target.
  - [x] Announce in `#release` **@mjbvz**
    > :loudspeaker: Extension authors ensure all release branch changes have been published to users, manually building and releasing if necessary.
- [x] Build but don't release a `stable` build from release/<x.y> branch to ensure stable build is green **@mjbvz**
- [x] Build but don't release a [Copilot Chat stable](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=500) build from release/<x.y> branch **@mjbvz**
- [x] Install the new stable vscode and new copilot chat stable version and verify that old chat sessions still render with no errors and can be resumed in the new version  **@mjbvz**
- [x] [Create next milestone](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/milestones/new) on `microsoft/vscode` repo and ensure that it has a due date. The created milestone and its due date will be automatically synced across our repos. **@mjbvz**

##### Friday

- [ ] Only candidate issues are open and assigned to [🔖milestone](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22)
- [ ] All issues [🔖verified](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
- [ ] All open PRs on the milestone [🔖merged or deferred](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Apr%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22)
- [x] Fix [`candidate` issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20label%3Acandidate) (major bugs only)
  - Discuss and get approval in stand up
  - Review and merge into `release/<x.y>`
  - [Queue new auto-published insiders build](https://monacotools.visualstudio.com/Monaco/_build?definitionId=111) as candidates are merged **@mjbvz** 
  - Author of candidate PR should find verifier
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] yo generator **@aeschli**
  - [ ] js-debug **@connor4312**
  - [ ] Debug Adapter Protocol **@connor4312**
  - [ ] vscode-debugadapter-node **@connor4312**
  - [x] vscode-test-web **@aeschli**
- [ ] All release notes updated
  - release notes are collected in a file named _`v<Major>_<Minor>.md`\_ in this [repo directory](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/)
  - Release notes screen recording guidance: https://microsoft-my.sharepoint.com/:p:/p/buhollan/Ecg_j89jzlVGtfqWGy7SQBEB_OsuLPZ65jjKRVlo_OdlgA
- [ ] Documentation added or updated
- [ ] [Acknowledge third-party pull requests](https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/acknowledgement) in release notes. **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Acknowledge [issue trackers](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Community-Triage---Credits) from the community **@chrmarti**
- When done fixing/verifying and there are changes since last build at the end of day PT
  - [x] Build and manually release Insider from release/<x.y> for Code **@mjbvz**
  - [x] Build and manually release Insider from release/<x.y> for vscode.dev (if there were vscode.dev candidates) **@mjbvz**

##### Monday

- [ ] Polish release notes **@ntrogh**
- [ ] Schedule an endgame restrospective with with @mjbvz, endgame buddy, and next @mjbvz for this week. [Retrospective template](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/blob/main/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/endgame-retrospective.md#L14)
- [ ] Decide whether a [Patch Tuesday release](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Handling-MSRC-Cases#msrc--patch-tuesday-process) will happen:
  - Check the internal iteration plan for scheduled security issues (MSRCs) to determine if a Patch Tuesday release is needed.
  - If no Patch Tuesday release is planned, use the [Patch Tuesday E-Mail Template](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Patch-Tuesday-E-Mail-Template) to let the Updates team ([MDClientPatching@microsoft.com](mailto:MDClientPatching@microsoft.com)) know of that fact. Please cc Monacotools on this email as the client patching team has asked us to do so. **@mjbvz**
  - Otherwise, if a Patch Tuesday release is necessary, start off a [Patch Tuesday Release plan](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Handling-MSRC-Cases#are-you-endgame-champbuddy) **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Remind the team: if they are going to be OOF for more than five days during the next iteration, assign someone to look out for critical issues in their feature areas and fix them if necessary. This helps with bug identification and fixing for recovery releases. **@mjbvz**

##### Monday - Wednesday

- [ ] [🔖milestone issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22)
- [ ] [🔖candidate issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20label%3Acandidate)
- [ ] Polish release notes **redmond**
- [ ] Fix [`candidate` issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20milestone%3A%22September%202025%22%20label%3Acandidate) (major bugs only)
  - Discuss and get approval in stand up
  - Review and merge into `release/<x.y>`
  - [Queue new auto-published insiders build](https://monacotools.visualstudio.com/Monaco/_build?definitionId=111) as candidates are merged **@mjbvz** 
  - [Queue new Copilot Chat pre-release builds](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=489) as candidates are merged by manually running against the release branch **@mjbvz**
  - Author of candidate PR should find verifier
- [ ] Build but don't release stable for all platforms as new candidate issues come in **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Coordinate the official release timing with team and more specifically, team extension authors (ex: Jupyter and Copilot rely on VS Code release) **@mjbvz**

> **Note:** The `Insiders` build needs to be in the wild for 24 hours before we can enter the last phase of the endgame, though the sanity testing step alone can happen earlier if there are no new candidates. **@mjbvz**


##### Wednesday/Thursday - Expected release day (this may change)

- [ ] Build stable for all platforms **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Manually run the [Copilot Chat stable pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=500) against the `release/<version>` branch **@mjbvz**
  - Enable `Publish Extension`, you do not need an approval to build the VSIX.
  - **DO NOT** ask for approval for the extension publish step yet. This step should only be done 1 hour before VS Code core releases (see release plan for Wednesday/Thursday for more info).
  - If the simulation tests fail due to cache changes on `main`, you will need to specify running with the release branch of the cache. You can do this under "Resources" when scheduling the pipeline.
- [ ] Sanity Testing Copilot Chat Stable
  - [ ] VS Code RC
    - [ ] anyOS
  - [ ] Codespaces Web using Insiders (Until CAPI supports Codespaces tokens natively. See [#6095](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot/issues/6095#issuecomment-2289644474) for more information)
    - We use Insiders because we cannot use Codespaces Web on core builds that are not released yet (even with custom query parameters in the URL).
- Keep an eye out for any changes in the core RC (via candidates) that may require Copilot Chat to sanity test again on a new core stable build. **@mjbvz**
- [ ] [Sanity Testing VS Code Stable](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Sanity-Check)
  - [ ] Windows 64 bit **owner**
    - [ ] System Installer
    - [ ] User Installer
    - [ ] Archive
    - [ ] Server
    - [ ] CLI
  - [ ] Windows ARM64 **owner**
    - [ ] System Installer
    - [ ] User Installer
    - [ ] Archive
    - [ ] Server
    - [ ] CLI
  - [ ] macOS Intel **owner**
    - [ ] Archive
    - [ ] Universal Archive
    - [ ] Server
    - [ ] CLI
  - [ ] macOS ARM64 **owner**
    - [ ] Archive
    - [ ] Universal Archive
    - [ ] Server
    - [ ] CLI
  - [ ] Linux x64 **owner**
    - [ ] Archive
    - [ ] DEB
    - [ ] RPM
    - [ ] Snap
  - [ ] Linux Server and CLI **owner** _(can be tested from any OS with Docker)_
    - [ ] x64
    - [ ] ARM32
    - [ ] ARM64
    - [ ] x64 Alpine
    - [ ] ARM64 Alpine
- [ ] Release Copilot Chat **1 HOUR** before VS Code releases **@mjbvz**
  - [ ] Approve the `Publish` stage of the last [Copilot Chat stable pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=500) that's successfully sanity tested.
    - Note that there are __two__ steps that need approval to publish the extension to the marketplace.
  - [ ] In `vscode-copilot-chat`, bump the engines.vscode version on the `main` branch to point to the next version. For example, from `1.81.0` to `1.82.0`. This ensures pre-release only runs on the latest insiders, which is necessary for proposed API development. Does not require the insiders to be released, only to be available on the builds page.
  - [ ] In `vscode-copilot-chat`, run `npm install` to update `package-lock.json`
- [ ] Manually release a new pre-release from main by running [the pre-release pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=489).
- [ ] [Publish website](<https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-website?tab=readme-ov-file#publishing-a-website-change)>) **@ntrogh** **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Release stable from builds page no later than 11am PT **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Trigger the [[vscode.dev] 🚀 Deploy](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=276) pipeline from `release/x.y`, with the `prod` Deployment Target. ⚠️ Peer approval needed. **@mjbvz**
  - [ ] Request approval from another team member at the necessary step to deploy the vscode.dev build. **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Create an official release **@mjbvz**
  - [ ] Create a tag (make sure you pull the release branch first): `git tag <x.y.z>`
  - [ ] Push the tag: `git push origin <x.y.z>`
  - [ ] Create a GitHub release: [Open the GitHub tags](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/tags), and click far right `... > Create Release`. Use the correct title and description from our release notes. Also change the relative links for the key highlight list items to absolute links [Example](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/releases/tag/1.39.0)
- [ ] X announcement **@pierceboggan**
- [ ] Create and publish next release notes placeholder **@ntrogh**
- [ ] Enable Continuous Release in the [Insiders builds page](https://builds.code.visualstudio.com/builds/insider) **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Release the latest Insiders build from the [Insiders builds page](https://builds.code.visualstudio.com/builds/insider) **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Trigger the [[vscode.dev] 🚀 Deploy](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=276) pipeline from `main`, with the `insiders` Deployment Target. **@mjbvz**
- [ ] [Publish @types/vscode](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Publish-vscode-types) if you find type diffs after running the steps **@mjbvz**
- [ ] Close the milestone on [GitHub](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/milestones) **@mjbvz**

labels.description: VS Code - Next release plan for endgame

- use [this extension](https://github.com/aeschli/promptFileContributions) (or write your own) that contributes prompt files, instruction files and mode files with the new contribution points: `chatPromptFiles`, `chatInstructions` and `chatModes` 
- install that extension and use the gear icon in the chat view to whether the new prompt files, instruction files and mode files were added

title: 'Trusted Type' CSP Error

body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262161 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/267811

- [x] anyOS @connor4312 
- [x] anyOS @ntrogh

Complexity: 3


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268963%0A%0A&assignees=aeschli)

---

Tool names in prompt files and mode files are now qualified by the extension or the MCP server

- install a MC server and an extension with tools (e.g. github pull request extension_
- create a prompt file, add a `tools` attribute and use the `configure tools...` code lens
- add some tools. 
- verify that in the prompt file 
  - all tools from mcp servers are qualified by the mcp server name
  - all tools from extensions are qualified by the extensions id
  - all tools from tool sets are qualified by the tool set name
- verify that you get an warning when the tool name is unknown/misspelled
- verify that you get an info the tool name is unqualified
- verify that you get a code action that fixes the name from unqualified to qualified
- verify that when you have multiple tool names that are unqualified, there is a code action that fixes them all
- verify that the prompt and modes work
- after running a prompt, run `/list` to see all enabled tools
- also check the request log to so that the right tools are applied: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Copilot-Issues#language-model-requests-and-responses

comments.body: Fully qualified names work well! One minor issue with selecting individual tools in a custom tool set.

title: Coding agent spinner goes forever in empty vscode window

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.105.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows_NT arm64 10.0.26100

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ask agent mode to make changes 
2. Don't keep/undo
3. Start typing in the file that was edited and observe panel.edit.feedback events firing with every keystroke (it looks like 2-3 per keystroke)

I would expect that this event should only fire when the user chooses keep or undo.

@isidorn

comments.body:
I can reproduce this. @connor4312 assigning first to you since you own the agent editing experience.
Also assigning to September - since this bug is stopping us from using the `panel.edit.feedback` event for dashboards.
What is the intention behind this telemety event? When should it get sent? It looks like it has worked this way since inception.
I'll fix it imo I think this is a pretty bad metric to base things on. I make slight tweaks/edits to what the agent gives me back all the time, even though I accept the majority of the edit.
I know @hediet did a bunch of work on the ARC metric for NES and we discussed getting that pipeline into normal agent edits too, I think that would be more ideal

@connor4312 we do have those metrics. And those metrics help us figure out the "commit survival". 

Now in addition to that metric we are exploring explicit Rejects. As a supplementary metric.
But maybe as a supplementary metric if you start editing code no Reject should actually be fired. 

It might turn out that this supplementary metric is not useful, but we can not know that until we get our hands dirty with the data. Thus, to get our hands dirty the easiest fix from  your side would work.

title: Repeated Issue

body:
Refs - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262904

- [x] anyOS @connor4312 
- [x] anyOS @benibenj

Complexity: 4

Roles: Developer


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268950%0A%0A&assignees=sandy081)

---

With the API described in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262904 you can now easily wrap a NPM package MCP server inside an extension.

Here is the API - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/fbfb7349634c6b276b68941764497a18aa16082e/src/vscode-dts/vscode.d.ts#L20347-L20395

**NOTE:** Use this [build](https://builds.code.visualstudio.com/builds/insider?commit=fbfb7349634c6b276b68941764497a18aa16082e&dev=true) to test this TPI

To Test:

- Create a new extension 
- Pick a mcp server with npm package you want to wrap. Eg: `@playwright/mcp` or `@modelcontextprotocol/server-sequential-thinking` or `@modelcontextprotocol/server-memory`
- Add dependency to one of the above npm packages in your extension's package.json
- run `npm install`
- create a vscode.d.ts file in the root folder and copy the contents from [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/fbfb7349634c6b276b68941764497a18aa16082e/src/vscode-dts/vscode.d.ts)
- Contribute `mcpServerDefinitionProviders` for above picked mcp server
```json
"contributes": {
		"mcpServerDefinitionProviders": [
			{
				"id": "playwright",
				"label": "Playwright"
			}
		]
	}
```
- Register the MCP provider for above contribution in `extension.ts` using the API that needs to be tested
```ts
context.subscriptions.push(vscode.lm.registerMcpServerDefinitionProvider('context7', {
		provideMcpServerDefinitions(): vscode.McpServerDefinition[] {
			return [
				new vscode.McpPackageServerDefinition(
					'playwright',
					'@playwright/mcp',
					vscode.McpPackageKind.Node
				)
			];
		}
	}));
```
- Compile and run the extension
- Make sure the tools picker (in chat) contains tools from your mcp server
- Test further with this API by playing around with various other options and also read the doc if it makes sense
title: Test NPM MCP Package provider

body: Type: Snaphot Hi, I lost a recent chat session while using Copilot (ChatGPT) to build an important project. The connection dropped unexpectedly and I lost the entire recent conversation and the work I had been guided through. Impact: The lost conversation contained step-by-step guidance and design decisions that would be difficult or impossible to reproduce. This is a major productivity loss for users who rely on the chat as a development partner. Requested improvements ("SNAPSHOT"): One-click "Snapshot workspace" that saves a complete local backup of the current session, including chat transcript, unsent drafts, workspace metadata (e.g., attached .code-workspace), environment settings, and a timestamped session ID. Periodic automatic snapshots (opt-in) to local storage (IndexedDB or user-specified folder) with a simple UI to restore the latest snapshot. Export options (JSON, plain text, PDF) and an "Export with workspace" option that packages the chat transcript with workspace metadata. Visible session ID and timestamp to assist support and reproducible bug reports. Improved offline handling: queue failed sends and automatically retry on reconnect, plus a clear status indicator and a manual retry option. Why this helps: Prevents loss of high-value sessions, especially for anonymous or signed-out users. Makes it easy to back up progress, work offline, and produce reproducible bug reports. Improves trust and usability for users who treat the chat as a core development tool. I’m happy to provide additional details, screenshots, or a sample transcript if that helps. Thanks for considering this feature. Best regards, Allan VS Code version: Code 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26220 Modes:
title: Request: One-click "Snapshot workspace" + autosave/export to prevent lost chats

title: MSAL broker not working

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->


**TL;DR**: VSCode Remote-WSL 0.104.2 incorrectly assumes `wsl.exe --list --verbose` outputs UTF-8 after detecting WSL2, but the command actually outputs UTF-16LE on some systems, causing "No distros installed" error.


Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: N/A (requires the Remote - WSL extension; reproduces with only that extension enabled)

I have still chosen this repository because of the interaction with the `RemoteAuthorityResolver` and the specific failure mode.

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104.2 (e3a5acf)
- Remote - WSL: 0.104.2
- OS Version: Windows 11 Enterprise 23H2 (22631.5909)
- WSL: Ubuntu (default), WSL2, kernel 5.10.102.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In a WSL shell, `code .` inside any directory (or open a WSL folder via File → Open).
2. After ~2–3 seconds, VS Code shows “No WSL distros found.”  
   Window/Extension Host logs show `resolveAuthority(wsl) ... returned an error No distros installed.`

Expected:
- VS Code connects to `wsl+Ubuntu`, registers the WSL filesystem provider, and opens the folder.

Actual:
- Remote connection fails immediately with “No distros installed.” Remote FS provider never registers.

Key Diagnostics (short):

- **WSL extension log** (`Remote-WSL: Show Log`) includes:
  ```
  WSL feature installed: true (wsl --status), using utf-8 encoding
  ...
  No distros found: " \^@ \^@N\^@A\^@M\^@E\^@ ... \^@2\^@\r\^@\n\^@"
  ```
  The `\^@` bytes indicate **UTF-16LE** text was parsed as UTF-8.

- From Windows host:
  ```
  C:\Windows\System32\wsl.exe --list --verbose
    NAME      STATE           VERSION
  * Ubuntu    Running         2
  ```

  Capturing the raw bytes and/or printing via Node confirms **UTF-16LE** output:

  ```bash
  > node -e "const {execSync} = require('child_process'); process.stdout.write(execSync('/mnt/c/Windows/System32/wsl.exe --list --verbose'))" | xxd
  
  00000000: 2000 2000 4e00 4100 4d00 4500 2000 2000   . .N.A.M.E. . .
  [...]
  ```

  And a quick sanity check to confirm this:
  
  ```bash
  > node -e "const {execSync} = require('child_process'); const output = execSync('/mnt/c/Windows/System32/wsl.exe --list --verbose'); console.log(output.toString('utf16le'));"
    NAME      STATE           VERSION
  * Ubuntu    Running         2
  ```

Root Cause (from quick code read of the (deminified) shipped bundle):
- During startup, the extension runs `wsl.exe --status`; on success, logs _“using utf-8 encoding”_, and sets an internal encoding variable to `"utf-8"`.
- Subsequent `wsl.exe --list --verbose` output is then interpreted as UTF-8, but on this system `wsl.exe` actually returns **UTF-16LE**, so distro parsing fails and the resolver returns **“No distros installed.”**

Notes:
- Setting `extensions.supportNodeGlobalNavigator=true` (from the Node 22 migration note) removes the unrelated `PendingMigrationError`, but **does not** fix the WSL resolver failure. -- this is not a duplicate of [#252077](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/252077)
- `setx WSL_UTF8 0` was attempted earlier and did not resolve the issue. (the code makes this obvious)

---

**Temporary Local Workaround** (not a real fix; survives only until the next update):
- Edit the compiled extension file at  
  `%USERPROFILE%\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode-remote.remote-wsl-0.104.2\dist\node\extension.js`
  and change the one assignment that forces UTF-8 after `--status`:
  ```diff
  - (m = "utf-8"),
  + (m = "utf16le"),
  ```
  After this change, `wsl.exe --list --verbose` is read correctly and VS Code connects to WSL.

Suggestion:
  Check the actual encoding of `wsl.exe --list --verbose` output instead of assuming UTF-8 after a successful `--status` check. Options:
    - Detect UTF-16LE via BOM (0xFFFE) or byte patterns
    - Keep the original `utf16le` encoding for `wsl.exe` commands (only `wsl.exe --status` appears to return UTF-8 .. unless this has changed recently?)
    - Parse both attempts and use whichever succeeds

Attachments / More detail:
- Full notes, logs, and byte dumps are here: [Gist: Bughunt VSCode WSL](https://gist.github.com/Liu-Eroteme/5b75113cec96d329edc2aa0697b3ae35)

comments.body:
Thanks for sharing the analysis, great stuff!

The problem is that not all WSL installs and distros seem to be able to use UTF-8. My understanding was that it would be supported by all installs where `wsl -status` succeeds.

I reverted back the change and so we are using URF-16le again for all installs and distros.
Maybe I need to add some probing as suggested.
New release is on the way (0.104.3)...

title: Remote-WSL 0.104.2 parses wsl.exe --list --verbose as UTF-8 although output is UTF-16LE → “No distros installed” on 1.104.x [+WORKAROUND]

title: Rendering user code incorrectly

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Our VS Code extension contribute LLM tools that need a few custom copilot instructions to increase the accuracy of their tool invocation. We need a similar API to MCP server instructions https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/250017 that would allow our extension to provide custom copilot instructions when the extension is installed.

Currently the only way to add such custom instructions is to write to user's copilot-instructions.md, considering that the copilot instructions settings is deprecated. This is not a great user experience because users will need to do additional work to deal with these new changes in their version control system.

comments.body:
See https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/251580 you can now contribute instructions via a extension contribution.
Be considerate when doing so, don't fill the users context window, do not use `applyTo: **` but rely on a god description so the agent mode will pick up your instructions when it is applicable.

title: Allow extensions to contribute custom copilot isntructions silently

body:
- VS Code Version: 
  - Stable: 1.104.2 (Universal) — Electron 37.3.1
  - Insiders: 1.105.0-insider (2025-09-29) — Electron 37.3.1
- OS Version: macOS 26.0 (Tahoe), Darwin arm64 25.0.0

---

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Launch VS Code (Stable or Insiders) on macOS 26 Tahoe.  
2. Open any folder (even empty).  
3. Wait or interact with the editor — within minutes, the window freezes with:  
   > “The window is not responding. You can reopen or close the window or keep waiting.”

This occurs even:
- With all extensions disabled (`code --disable-extensions`)  
- With a fresh user data directory (`code --user-data-dir ~/test-vscode`)  
- With GPU acceleration disabled via `argv.json`  

---

### Actual Behavior

- Both VS Code Stable and Insiders consistently freeze on macOS 26 (Tahoe).  
- The app becomes unresponsive and shows the “The window is not responding” dialog.  
- Electron version in both builds is **37.3.1**, which is affected by [electron/electron#48311](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/48311).

---

### Expected Behavior

- According to [electron/electron#48311](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/48311), the freeze/WindowServer issue is fixed in Electron **36.9.2, 37.6.0, 38.2.0, and 39.0.0-alpha.7**.

---

### Request

Please bump the Electron dependency in VS Code Insiders to **≥37.6.0** so we can verify the fix on macOS 26 (Tahoe).  

Thanks! 🙏

comments.body: Looks related to #268328

I'm not sure if that bug would cause VSCode to freeze. It usually just causes high GPU load, leading to hotter than usual laptop and general slowness.

@anna-teruel can you please verify launching vscode with the following environment variables fixes your issue?

`CHROME_HEADLESS=1 code`
Or for insiders
`CHROME_HEADLESS=1 code-insiders`

Verify this worked by observing that
(1) Window shadows are gone from vscode
(2) Is your freezing bug still occurring?

I tested with the environment variable as suggested:

```
CHROME_HEADLESS=1 open -a "Visual Studio Code - Insiders"
```

Results:
1️⃣ The window shadows were gone.
2️⃣ VS Code no longer freezes on macOS 26 (Tahoe) 🎉

As a workaround, I added CHROME_HEADLESS=1 permanently so I can run VS Code normally without freezes.

For curiosity: since this workaround resolves the freezing, does that mean the root cause is not the same Electron compositor/GPU bug reported in [electron/electron#48311](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/48311), but something else? What is it? 

Thanks again for the quick guidance 🙏

> I tested with the environment variable as suggested:
> 
> ```
> CHROME_HEADLESS=1 open -a "Visual Studio Code - Insiders"
> ```
> 
> Results: 1️⃣ The window shadows were gone. 2️⃣ VS Code no longer freezes on macOS 26 (Tahoe) 🎉
> 
> As a workaround, I added CHROME_HEADLESS=1 permanently so I can run VS Code normally without freezes.
> 
> For curiosity: since this workaround resolves the freezing, does that mean the root cause is not the same Electron compositor/GPU bug reported in [electron/electron#48311](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/48311), but something else? What is it?
> 
> Thanks again for the quick guidance 🙏

If it solves the freezing, then it is the exact same issue  [electron/electron#48311](https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/48311)

tip: 
```bash
launchctl setenv CHROME_HEADLESS 1
```
this workaround command will disable shadows for all electron-based apps. won't persist on computer reboots
Merging to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/268328
Looks like the newest **VSCode - Insiders** update has Electron=37.6.0 and the shadow fix is no longer necessary!

title: macOS 26 (Tahoe): VS Code freezes due to Electron 37.3.1 — fix is in Electron ≥37.6.0

body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/196616

- [x] macOS @sandy081
- [x] linux @joshspicer
- [x] windows @digitarald

Complexity: 3


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268930%0A%0A&assignees=TylerLeonhardt)

---
This iteration we finalized an API that allows you to retrieve the keys of everything you've stored in SecretStorage.

```
declare module 'vscode' {

	export interface SecretStorage {
		/**
		 * Retrieve the keys of all the secrets stored by this extension.
		 */
		keys(): Thenable<string[]>;
	}
}
```

Some extensions want to delete what's in secret storage on unregister... so this API allows them to do so by getting all keys needed to be deleted.

This is just one scenario, you may also use SecretStorage to determine state and seeing what keys are set may influence your code.



### Prereqs

* Have an extension (don't have one? [create one](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/get-started/your-first-extension)!)
* Run `npx @vscode/dts main` to get the `vscode.d.ts` API file

### Using the API

All I want you to do is play around with the API a bit to make sure it's sane. It's pretty simple, but I've left this at complexity 3 since it involves an extension.
title: Test: Finalized Secret Storage `keys()` API

<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/268080

- [x] anyOS @ulugbekna
- [x] anyOS @minsa110

Complexity: 2


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268927%0A%0A&assignees=eli-w-king)

---

In this milestone we've updated the chat panel's history preview. This section displays the most recent chat sessions, and included an entry point for displaying full chat history. We've added the ability to hide this section, and confiture its setting by right clicking on the chat panel. 

### Prerequisites 

- Latest Insiders
- Latest Copilot extension
- Configure setting: `"chat.emptyState.history.enabled": true`

### Testing 
**Right Click Menu & Settings Persistence**
1. Right clicking on chat panel shows option to hide/show chat history preview.
2. Toggling setting hides/shows history section immediately.
3. Toggled hide/show persists across chat sessions.

**Side Panel Rendering**
1. Recent chat sessions are displayed as expected.
2. Recent chats render as expected when switching between active sessions and/or sessions selected from workspace history.
3. Chat history updates to include new sessions.
4. Disclaimer text is rendered as expected when resizing chat panel.
title: Test: Chat history preview in empty state

body: Refs https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/267459, https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/268386 - [x] Windows @jruales - [x] macOS @sbatten - [x] Linux @vijayupadya Complexity: 3 [Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268926%0A%0A&assignees=meganrogge) --- A new setting `task.notifyWindowOnTaskCompletion`, set to 1 minute by default, controls the minimum execution time for a task that warrants notifying the user when the task finishes AND the window is not currently focused. This will apply to all tasks you manually run. It will only apply to tasks run by the chat agent if `chat.notifyWindowOnResponseReceived` is disabled. Changing the setting to `0` should disable the behavior. This should only appear on run of a task, not when the task later becomes active then inactive again. That should not trigger a notification, as it's usually faster and our `Active` event fires continuously, making it difficult to accurately reset the start time. Ensure you have the right permissions for your OS:

- [x] Windows @dmitrivMS 
- [x] macOS @eli-w-king 
- [x] anyOS @aeschli 

Complexity: 2


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23268922%0A%0A&assignees=meganrogge)

---

When `terminal.integrated.title` has the default value, `${process}`, the name of the terminal will change when the process changes. 

For tasks, this can be unexpected and cause confusion. 

We now persist the task's name.

To verify, create a task that will lead to a process change. Confirm that the name does not change.

body:
Type: Bug 1. Install the Dev Containers extension. 2. Setup a `docker/podman` container (I'm using `podman`, and created a container based upon `php:8.4-apache`, but container executable and OS shouldn't make a difference). 3. Run the container and attach VS Code to it. 4. Open the Command Palette -> Terminal: Create New Integrated Terminal (local). 5. Observe error popup in bottom-right corner of VS Code window. 6. Open `settings.json` and add the following: ``` "terminal.integrated.profiles.osx": { "bash": { "path": "/path/to/bash" } } ``` 7. Repeat 4 & 5. 8. Change `osx` in the above setting config. to `linux`. 9. Repeat 4 & 5. This is similar to #148572, but my host machine is a MacBook Pro M3 Pro, not a Windows PC. Quoting from that issue: > I also just ran into this, also with a local macOS environment and a Linux remote. FWIW, I found that there's an additional wrinkle: the file referred to by `path` needs to exist and be executable. So, for example, if you're using zsh installed by homebrew on a Apple Silicon Mac, `/opt/homebrew/bin/zsh` needs to exist and be executable in the container. If it doesn't, VSCode falls back to `/usr/bin/zsh`. > > This config worked for me: > > ``` > "terminal.integrated.profiles.linux": { > "zsh": { > "path": "/opt/homebrew/bin/zsh" > } > } > ``` As mentioned in reproduction steps 6 and 8, that doesn't work for me. I changed `zsh` to `bash` for both configs and even though that executable exists in that path (I use it practically every freaking day so I am 1000% sure of this), I still get VS Code complaining that `/usr/bin/bash` doesn't exist. Well of course it doesn't! This is an Apple machine, the laws of physics and all things holy within the universe dictate that Apple things just **have** to be different and cause stupid freaking errors like this 😠 . Anyway apologies for the sarcastic rant, and if a dev could look into this, I'd be eternally grateful. Ideally, the local terminal option should read the `terminal.integrated.profiles.*` settings for the appropriate host platorm and stop insisting on `/usr/bin/bash` (or /bin/bash for Linux/WSL). MTIA! 😄 VS Code version: Code 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z) OS version: Darwin arm64 24.6.0 Modes: Remote OS version: Linux arm64 6.12.13-200.fc41.aarch64

Oops, at first glance of the other issue's instructions, I didn't notice the most crucial part:
> So, for example, if you're using zsh installed by homebrew on a Apple Silicon Mac, /opt/homebrew/bin/zsh needs to exist and be executable **in the container** (emphasis mine)

@apotterri, I wish you had've written that "in the container" part in 100 pt font and all caps, coz it would've saved me about 2 hours worth of fidgeting around this stupid bug and trying to create this issue! Anyway, many thanks for the solution! 🔥🔥🔥

And BTW devs, I'd still **really** appreciate it if the whole "needs to exist and be executable in the container" thing was not a thing. I tried so many different settings configs before finally giving up and coming here, but then still missed the crucial part of [apotterri](https://github.com/apotterri)'s comment until now. So if this feature had just been set up in an intuitive way in the first place, it would've saved me hours!

body:
From: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/267408#issuecomment-3347816619 

We added debounce: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/262436 

I think the debounce for show gets queued, and even though hide() gets called, the queued up show up, making a 'flash' animation. 

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/129fc22930939a6a485060b1fad66a2af21cafbc/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminalContrib/stickyScroll/browser/terminalStickyScrollOverlay.ts#L198-L200

Maybe the fix is cancel any pending or queued up _show when hide() is called.

comments.body:
> It's better, though it reacts with a delay. See here VS Code compared to iTerm2:

@joaomoreno that was actually by design. `clear` is taking a while I think due to git status taking a bit, and before that happens it's just acting normally since `clear` started above the scroll. TIL iterm2 added sticky scroll too, it appears they might hardcode clear to never be sticky so we can do that too to smooth out this scenario.

Yeah +1 on hardcode clear to never be sticky. I don't think people get much value out of `clear` being in the sticky UI in the first place. Updated PR here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/268921

You only need to sign in to one thing, we tested this last month already... but if you wanna sign in to multiple, go for it. The Microsoft Auth extension should support multiple accounts. You can sign in to your work account or a personal account.

title: error with request

body:
### Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Start a chat with the agent in VS Code (e.g., using GitHub Copilot Chat).
2.  Provide a relatively complex task that requires multiple steps to complete. For example, "Refactor the authentication logic in my application. First, move the user validation to a separate service. Then, implement JWT token generation. Finally, create a middleware to protect the routes."
3.  The agent correctly creates an initial "todo" list or plan of action, showing the steps it will take.
4.  The agent starts working on the first task (e.g., creating the validation service). This task might take a while or involve multiple file modifications.
5.  After some time working on this single sub-task, the agent seems to "forget" the original, complete "todo" list.
6.  It then generates a new, often different, "todo" list that might not align with the original plan, effectively losing the initial path.

### Expected Behavior:

The agent should maintain the context of the original plan or "todo" list throughout the entire process, even when working on a single, time-consuming sub-task. It should refer back to the initial plan to understand what the next step is after completing the current one.

### Actual Behavior:

The agent loses the context of the initial plan. After focusing on one part of the task for a while, it creates a new plan that often deviates from the original goal. This breaks the workflow, as the agent loses the "route" or the overall strategy that was established at the beginning. It's as if the agent's short-term memory of the task overrides its long-term memory of the overall plan.

This behavior is particularly noticeable in longer-running, multi-step tasks and can be frustrating as it requires manually reminding the agent of the original plan.
title: Agent mode loses track of the initial plan/todo list during long-running tasks
