title: ne plus afficher la suite du code

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Currently new files created by copilot will not show up in the files changed area above the prompt area, or as files changed in the explorer window (box with dot in it) making going through changes from prompt to prompt very confusing.

Sometimes new files will show up if there were additional modifications done after they were created within that prompt session, however that is not all of the time. This in general makes the files changed list (and explorer window) feel unreliable, and requires a lot of extra checking through the output each time just to get a picture of what was changed.

Maybe in the explorer window a different icon could show up instead of the modification box to symbolize that it is a new file altogether (maybe a box with a plus in it instead of a dot?), however due to how the undo functionality works it really should have some notation, since hitting undo would remove it, even when it appears that it is older code unrelated to the prompt.
title: Please add newly created files by copilot to the files changed list, as well as file explorer.

body:
Now the terminal tool is working, but I see this error every time the terminal tool is used in that environment. I don't think it's breaking anything but could still be a sign of something being wrong

```
debug [ProxiedWorkspace] [ProxiedWorkspace] WARNING: Error: Trying to add a disposable to a DisposableStore that has already been disposed of. The added object will be leaked!
    at GTi.add (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/out/vs/code/browser/workbench/workbench.js:27:1760)
    at g.value (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/out/vs/code/browser/workbench/workbench.js:2888:825)
    at m._deliver (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/node_modules/@xterm/xterm/lib/xterm.js:1:427020)
    at m._deliverQueue (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/node_modules/@xterm/xterm/lib/xterm.js:1:427126)
    at m.fire (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/node_modules/@xterm/xterm/lib/xterm.js:1:427461)
    at n.dispose (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/node_modules/@xterm/xterm/lib/xterm.js:1:223808)
    at Ne (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/out/vs/code/browser/workbench/workbench.js:27:750)
    at GTi.clear (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/out/vs/code/browser/workbench/workbench.js:27:1552)
    at GTi.dispose (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/out/vs/code/browser/workbench/workbench.js:27:1481)
    at Cmt.execute (http://127.0.0.1:40000/insider-588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4/static/out/vs/code/browser/workbench/workbench.js:2889:33)
```

comments.body:
This is coming from this line https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/d0c28eefddc2db7aabb04cd98fa5ba7b02cd0f2e/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminalContrib/chatAgentTools/browser/executeStrategy/richExecuteStrategy.ts#L67. 

And this line is in the stack

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/d0c28eefddc2db7aabb04cd98fa5ba7b02cd0f2e/src/vs/workbench/contrib/terminalContrib/chatAgentTools/browser/executeStrategy/richExecuteStrategy.ts#L117

so I think that we disposed `store`, and disposed `this._startMarker`, which triggers `onDispose`. And there's no guarantee what order things will be disposed in.

If you expect `this._startMarker` to be disposed and recreated, then you are leaking it by accumulating old disposed markers in the store.

- VS Code Version: 
VSCode Version: 1.99.3
- OS Version: 
macOS: 26.0 (25A354)
Steps to Reproduce:
Java Version: Zulu 17.60 (but I was able to repro on multiple versions

1. Create a function
```
    public <R> Mono<Either<Throwable, ResponseEntity<List<SimpleProductTileV2>>>> noOfferProductDetails(
            BffRequestContext<R> requestContext) {
        
        // No liam return empty list of products
        return Mono.just(new Either.Right<>(new ResponseEntity<>(Collections.<SimpleProductTileV2>emptyList(), HttpStatus.OK)));
    }
```

2. Get error
```
Type mismatch: cannot convert from Mono<Either.Right<ResponseEntity<List<SimpleProductTileV2>>>> to Mono<Either<Throwable,ResponseEntity<List<SimpleProductTileV2>>>>
```
3. mvn compile works just fine
4. Looks like vs code compiler incorrectly decode Either.Right and it returns Object intead of T.

The cause is the fix for the accessible view on close focusing the most recently focused response.
This is happening I think because focus moves to the last response item then goes to the accessible view, by design. This will be tricky to fix.

title: repeated error  - chat crashing

body: Affected cases: - can't send command through terminal accessed with `ssh` - can't send command through terminal for docker container running in interactive mode - can't send command to `cmd` terminal - copilot keeps reopening new powershell terminal Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Issues is specific to Copilot extension Version: 1.105.0-insider (user setup) Commit: 588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4 Date: 2025-09-26T05:05:03.410Z Electron: 37.3.1 ElectronBuildId: 12404162 Chromium: 138.0.7204.235 Node.js: 22.18.0 V8: 13.8.258.31-electron.0 OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 github.copilot 1.376.1794 github.copilot-chat n0.32.2025092602 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start new session with https://labs.play-with-docker.com/, add new instance 2. On the website there will be `ssh` field with something like `ssh ip192-168-1-100-abcdef123456@direct.labs.play-with-docker.com` 3. Open agent chat, ask it to echo in the current shell: 4. Run `ssh` command you've copied above. You'll notice that terminal will look a bit differently now. 5. Ask to echo something again. Instead of using active ssh shell, it's opening new powershell tab. This issue makes it impossible to work with remotely accessed shells. ---- A workaround is to ask for commands to execute and execute them yourself

body: Type: Feature Request In the latest insider build if I escape out of the accessible view I am placed in the chat history. Is it possible to allow one to return to the input prompt without having to press ctrl+down arrow? If not, this is fine but wondering if this could be configurable. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.105.0-insider (588279f5b77b10bc41f3f8bb864350814e3823f4, 2025-09-26T05:05:03.410Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

comments.body: @meganrogge Is this new behavior by design? I am fine if it is but wondering if this could be configurable. BTW, I love you to pieces with accessible view remembering where you were when going back. Huge win!

Hey @accesswatch the design of the accessible view is to always place focus on what was previously focused before so that users know what to expect. We do this everywhere around the workbench, so changing that pattern here would be unexpected and could break people's muscle memory. 

Glad you're enjoying the fixes 😄 thanks for testing!

title: can we get a setting to control placement of focus when exitting accessible view?

body:
# Feature Request: Add configurable "family" field for OpenAI Compatible models

## Summary

Add the ability to configure a custom "family" field when setting up OpenAI Compatible models, enabling proper model-specific behavior when using proxied native models.

## Problem

Currently, all OpenAI Compatible models are assigned the same `family: "CustomOAI"` regardless of the actual underlying model being proxied. This prevents the extension from applying model-specific optimizations, prompts, and behaviors that exist throughout the codebase.

### Current Behavior
When configuring an OpenAI Compatible model (e.g., `gpt-5` via a proxy), the model information shows:
```typescript
{
  id: "my-gpt-5-proxy",
  name: "GPT-5 via Proxy", 
  family: "CustomOAI",  // Always the same
  // ...
}
```

### Expected Behavior
Users should be able to specify the actual model family:
```typescript
{
  id: "my-gpt-5-proxy",
  name: "GPT-5 via Proxy",
  family: "gpt-5",     // Configurable by user
  // ...
}
```

## Why This Matters

The VS Code Copilot Chat extension contains extensive model-specific logic that relies on the `family` field:

### 1. **Prompt Optimization** (`src/extension/prompts/node/agent/agentInstructions.tsx`)
- Different instruction sets for GPT vs Claude vs Gemini models
- Model-specific communication styles and formatting preferences
- Specialized prompts like `AlternateGPTPrompt` for GPT models

### 2. **Tool Schema Normalization** (`src/extension/tools/common/toolSchemaNormalizer.ts`)
- GPT-4o has specific JSON schema limitations requiring normalization
- Different schema draft versions supported by different model families

### 3. **Model Capabilities** (`src/platform/endpoint/common/chatModelCapabilities.ts`)
- `modelCanUseReplaceStringExclusively()` - Claude/Anthropic models
- `modelCanUseMcpResultImageURL()` - excludes Claude models  
- `modelCanUseImageURL()` - excludes Gemini models
- `modelSupportsApplyPatch()` - GPT models (excluding GPT-4o)
- `modelCanUseApplyPatchExclusively()` - GPT-5 models only

### 4. **Edit Tool Selection**
- Different editing strategies based on model capabilities
- Replace string vs apply patch preferences
- Multi-replace string support varies by family

### 5. **Response Processing**
- Different instruction placement (system vs user messages) for Claude models
- Model-specific output formatting requirements

## Use Cases

1. **Proxy Services**: Users running GPT-5, Claude, or other native models through proxy services (CLIProxyAPI, custom proxies, etc.)
2. **Cost Optimization**: Using OpenAI Compatible endpoints for cheaper access to premium models
3. **Corporate Deployments**: Internal proxies for security/compliance while maintaining model-specific behavior
4. **Model Testing**: Comparing different models through a unified proxy interface

## Proposed Implementation

Add a `family` field to the Custom OAI model configuration UI:

### Configuration Steps
1. Model ID: `my-gpt-5`
2. Display Name: `GPT-5 via Proxy`  
3. API URL: `https://my-proxy.com/v1`
4. **Model Family**: `gpt-5` (new field with suggestions)
5. Capabilities: Tool Calling, Vision, etc.
6. Token Limits: Max input/output tokens

### Family Field Options
- Dropdown with common families: `gpt-4`, `gpt-4o`, `gpt-5`, `claude-3`, `claude-3.5-sonnet`, `gemini`, `custom`
- Allow custom text input for new/unlisted model families
- Default to `CustomOAI` for backwards compatibility

### Code Changes Required
- Modify `CustomOAIModelConfigurator._configureModel()` to include family selection
- Update `ModelConfig` interface to include optional `family` field
- Modify `CustomOAIBYOKModelProvider.createModelInfo()` to use configured family
- Ensure backward compatibility with existing configurations

## Benefits

1. **Better User Experience**: Proper model-specific behavior without manual workarounds
2. **Proxy Compatibility**: Full feature parity when using models through proxies  
3. **Future-Proof**: Easy to add new model families as they become available
4. **Developer Friendly**: Consistent behavior regardless of how models are accessed

## Alternative Solutions Considered

1. **Auto-detection**: Parsing model IDs to infer family - fragile and unreliable
2. **Separate providers**: Creating individual providers for each family - increases complexity
3. **Runtime switching**: Detecting model family at request time - performance overhead

The configurable family field provides the best balance of flexibility, reliability, and user control.

## Additional Context

This feature would be particularly valuable for users of services like:
- CLIProxyAPI (OpenAI Compatible proxy for Claude and ChatGPT subscriptions)
- Corporate internal proxies
- Self-hosted model inference servers

By enabling proper family detection, users can get the full benefit of VS Code Copilot Chat's sophisticated model-specific optimizations regardless of their access method.
title: GitHub Copilot: Add configurable "family" field for OpenAI Compatible models

Expand set of MCP tools in Configure Tools: This seems to happen after updates to VS Code or the GitHub Copilot* extensions. Unconfirmed. Closing and restarting VS Code has resolved it each time.
title: MCP tools duplicated (after update?)

body: I have an MCP server with lots of tools, but there are some that I will never use. I want to limit the tools to just those that I care about. For instance, say I never work with Service Bus or Redis, I'd like to prevent those tools from filling up my context window. Copilot CLI already supports providing a comma separated list like this for a tools list: This opt-in approach is a bit fragile though as MCP servers are constantly changing and adding new tools. An alternative would be an opt-out list called `excluded_tools` that would filter out the list of tools provided and include everything else. This could be accomplished with Toolsets, but those are also not dynamic, and minimally visible since they sort to the bottom in a collapsed group in the UX.

comments.body: I think the underlying/deduplicated ask here is to have a default set of tools that are remembered across workspaces/modes. I think there are issues on this already but will let Martin decide

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/266058 is the request to be able to globally set a list of tools.

Right now we store enabled tools per workspace (for all agentic modes that don't configure tools via mode file) and via mode or prompt files.

title: Add the ability to limit tools from an MCP server

title: In debugging, step becomes continue

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.3
- VS Code Version: 1.104.2
- OS Version: Win 11 x64
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Prompt with attached image
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): GPT-4.1, Claude 4 Sonnet
- Logs: 
```
<attachments>

{"type":0,"imageUrl":{"url":"https://github.com/github-copilot/chat/attachments/abc123ab-aa11-2244-aaaa-abcd1234abcd123","detail":"high"}}

</attachments>
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Attach image to the prompt
2. Prompt "What is on the picture?"
3. Get correct answer
4. Go to Debug view and open and imageUrl from attachments
5. Get 404 error

I'm developing MCP servers and one of the tools need to accept an image.
Before, when user attached images, there were added to the context as base64. 
So, despite of taking some time, it wouldn't be a problem to pass image to the tool as base64.
Now image is added to the context as URL and there is no way I can get access to it from my MCP server tool. Strangely, when I prompt to give me the imageUrl from attachments model give me nonsense, even though I can see in Debug view that it's passed to the model.
And to be honest, even if I had a possibility to pass URL to my MCP server, I still wouldn't be able to access it, since when I open it in browser it returns GitHub 404 page.

I need a possibility to pass image to the MCP server. I believe there is a logic on the agent side to get the image from URL and present it to the model. Probably it was done for context window optimization and I'm not against it. But please give a possibility to get an attached image (by URL or any other method) inside MCP

comments.body:
Thanks for creating this issue! It looks like you may be using an old version of VS Code, the latest stable release is 1.104.2. Please try upgrading to the latest version and checking whether this issue remains.

Happy Coding!

hmmm this was done as an additional measure to help with image size limitations/context limits. we were seeing this happen particularly in MCP tool calls like playwright, which is what led to the behavior today. 

if you are the user sending the request to upload the image, it should not 404 and should download the image right away. 

we can investigate a way to make the base64 result visible, while sending the url to the model!

@justschen that would be great 👍 but I believe the possibility for Copilot to send working image link to the MCP should be also good. It doesn't heart to fetch image inside MCP to keep image handling approach consistent (always sending image as a link).

I'm rooting for anything that will work 😄

title: Images attachments behavior has changed

body: a couple of screenshots... `executeTask` indication is just visible via a spinner (that turns to a check) at the top with a task description like "Capturing Baseline Screenshot" Took me a while to understand that the tool calls shown to me were actually from within the executeTask, not the main thread. I think containerizing them somehow, or just making the executeTask more prominent would help me understand the layers more. I think the idea of an executeTask is very similar to Thinking... in that it's something I'm asking to be fired in the background... similar to how Thinking just kinda happens in the background without polluting my main thread. Oh, also, the todos with the `(X/Y)` are not executeTasks... even though their UI is so similar.
title: The UI around `executeTask` is hard to understand when there are a lot of tool calls

body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No - VS Code Version: 1.104.2 - OS Version: Windows 11 (64 bits) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open tab Postman in VSCode. 2. Execute endpoint 3. In the pretty tab everything appears without formatting, normally the first time it does NOT do it, but later the formatting is lost (with enters and tabs) 4. I already reported this situation with the Postman project (extension) and they mention that it is a VSCode problem, not theirs. 5.

title: After executing an endpoint in Postman extension, the formatting (pretty) is lost and everything is left unformatted

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Please add support for doing StreamableHTTP MCP servers over Unix domain sockets and named pipes. For local MCP servers, this is generally more secure than standard localhost HTTP. Standard IO servers are still preferable for local MCP servers, but some scenarios are better served by StreambleHTTP--for example, an MCP server can be hosted in the extension host process by an extension using this approach.

I plan to submit a pull request for this.

/cc @connor4312

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

title: MCP servers using StreamableHTTP should allow for Unix domain sockets / named pipes

comments.body: For some clarification, are you reporting that this is an issue with chat? Or is this an issue with the terminal on it's own (not a terminal call being kicked off by the agent in chat).
This is an issue with chat.
When you acknowledge a terminal command in chat and it gets run, the chat process just hangs and doesn't appear to attempt to check the terminal output

This will happen if your shell startup scripts conflict with and cause shell integration to fail to activate. An example of when this occurs is if you have `powerlevel10k` active. Please try commenting out various things in your startup scripts to find the culprit. You can hover the terminal tab, click `Show Details` and provide a screenshot also. Like:

@meganrogge interesting. I will get a screenshot soon.

Nothing from my setup has changed and this wasn't happening before, but I do have `powerlevel10k` active
`powerlevel10k` is the cause
tracking here https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/268339

<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version:  Code 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z)
- OS Version:  Windows_NT x64 10.0.19045

Steps to Reproduce:

When use system default cmd.exe, the menuconfig is working.

But when terminal.integrated.profiles.windows is configured with
```
    "terminal.integrated.profiles.windows": {
        "cmd-env-windows": {
            "path": "cmd.exe",
            "overrideName": true,
            "args": [
                "/K",
                "C:\\env-windows\\tools\\bin\\env-init.bat"
                // pushd bsp\qemu-virt64-riscv\
            ]
        },
    }
```
the env-windows is downloading from https://github.com/RT-Thread/env-windows

start integrated terminal in https://github.com/RT-Thread/rt-thread
Then entering the following commands:
```bat
pushd bsp\qemu-virt64-riscv\
menuconfig
```
Then we will found vscode integrated terminal do not respond to   `Up` `Down` Arrow key


Maybe related issue:
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/130075
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/146614
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/112405

comments.body: Hey, thanks for the issue. Since this is so specific to your profile, I don't think this is a vs code specific issue, so we can't fix it, thus closing.

title: terminal.integrated.profiles.windows not handling `Up` `Down` arrow key for menuconfig

title: No response from chat

body:
1. Open an empty chat editor
2. Click on one of the chat sessions in the history
3. :snake: Chat session opens in the secondary side bar instead of the chat editor in which I have clicked

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee908fed-7ef8-48b2-b52e-be3cb8c0f0df)

comments.body:
It looks like you are using the `ChatViewPane` to load the session which is the specifically the view in the secondary side bar. You should be able to use one of the chat services to do this.

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/66f7cad3a9525ebbb7f4dccacd5848e03a746954/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatWidget.ts#L1130-L1132

Also FYI, I don't think you need to get the viewService in this way:
`const viewsService = this.instantiationService.invokeFunction(accessor => accessor.get(IViewsService));`

Instead you can add it to the constructor like this:
`@IViewsService private readonly viewsService: IViewsService`

title: Selecting Chat history when in a Chat editor opens the chat session in the secondary side bar

<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104.2 (system setup)
- OS Version: Windows NT 10.0.26100
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In a Node.js project, create a file with the following imports:
```js
import 'dotenv/config'
import connectDb from '@/utils/mongo'
import express from 'express'
```
2. Save the file and run Organize Imports.
3. The imports are rearranged like this: 
```js
import connectDb from '@/utils/mongo'
import 'dotenv/config'
import express from 'express'
```
4. Any code in files imported before `dotenv/config` that relies on environment variables now breaks.

Can VS Code treat `dotenv` as a special case and leave it at the top?

comments.body:
👎 to special cases but you can add a newline in-between to force one import to always come first. Organize imports will sorts within these import groups:

```ts
import 'dotenv/config'

import connectDb from '@/utils/mongo'
import express from 'express'
```

labels.description: Issue represents a question, should be posted to StackOverflow (VS Code)

title: import dotenv reordered by "Organize Imports" feature

Thanks for creating this issue! It looks like you may be using an old version of VS Code, the latest stable release is 1.104.2. Please try upgrading to the latest version and checking whether this issue remains.

Happy Coding!

It looks like the issue is caused by one of your installed extensions. All extensions execute together on a single nodejs process, so in order to narrow down the possible problematic extension, please try the following:
* run `F1 > Help: Start Extension Bisect`
* (this will restart VS Code with half of your extensions disabled)
* try to do the steps which reproduce the problem
* if the problem reproduces, click "This is bad" (this narrows down the problematic extension to the half which was enabled)
* if the problem does not reproduce, click "Good now" (this narrows down the problematic extension to the half which was disabled)
* these steps will repeat until the problematic extension is found

| initial | step | final |
|---|---|---|
| ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047891/101918658-e9170f80-3bc9-11eb-9977-857baa291937.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047891/101918683-ef0cf080-3bc9-11eb-9f9e-98b0177991b2.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047891/101918706-f502d180-3bc9-11eb-8c86-e56355958bd4.png) |

title: Settings Sync keeps hammering the server and throttling itself

body:
Once you use a prompt file in a chat session, its tools override the set of tools used for your next message, this is counter intuitive.

I think a better approach with deciding which tools to use is:
* mode: is the default set of tools to use
* user choice: overrides the set of tools for the chat session
* prompt: overrides the default set and user choice with specific tools use once


//cc @digitarald @isidorn @ulugbekna

VS Code is defaulting to US keyboard, even when the system is configured to BR (ABNT2). It happens within the text editor and terminal.

Everywhere else in the system works as intended (ABNT2). It is the only layout configured.

I've downgraded to the previous version and it still happens.

Tried Keyboard:dispatch, both code and keyCode, no difference.

When on code container, it works properly.

Thanks!
title: Keyboard layout different from system

body:
Currently using Copilot Agent Insiders (Windows), follow-up commands get executed in a new terminal instance instead of staying in the same one.

Say I have a project broken down in different folders and to set up the Backend and downloading requirements, one needs to cd to Backend folder and install requirements

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a80277dc-9535-4fa2-9df4-adcf28636d11)

On Windows, running commands without "&&", the models would run "cd Backend" ; "pip install -r requirements.txt"

as different commands and run it on different terminals instead of continuing from where it changed directories to the Backend.

Very common behavior with Claude Sonnet 3.5, 3.7 and 4
about 50% of time with GPT-5 and GPT-5-Codex
Yet to try with other models, would update if I end up using any

- Copilot Version: 1.375.1792
- Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.3
- VS Code Version: 1.104.2
- OS Version: Windows 11 Home 23H2
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Agent Mode

labels.description: The run in terminal tool in chat

I attached the whole exercise folder to the chat and sent the message. 3. Instead of answering my question, I was asked further details "Please specify which file you'd like me to review (e.g., main.cpp, utils.hpp, or both). If you'd like me to review all files, let me know, and I will provide feedback on the implementation and suggest adjustments if necessary". 4. The folder I attached was a very simple/small one with 2-3 files maximum and with not much code written inside each file as it's just a simple c++ exercise about templates. There is not much infomation for the ai to process and have to ask further clarification. 5.I am using gpt-4o but if I ask the same questions directly on the chat gpt website with the same question and files it will not ask me further details and just answer my question. body:
every opportunity should send at least one `endOfLife` event. If there is no suggestion then we should send an empty one indicating the reason why there was none (`no suggestion`, `request cancelled`, ...)

The sending of the `endOfLife` event should be controlled by an exp value (at least for the first release) as it is unclear how many events this might lead to.

title: Horizontal scrolling with Magic Mouse doesn’t work when Editor: Experimental GPU Acceleration is enabled

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

#### Background

When I open the Test Results panel at the bottom, its internal "sidebar" (the tree / list of test runs and test items) appears on the right-hand side. Each time I use it, I get disoriented because in most applications, panels that combine a tree and details, the tree or navigation list is on the left and the details/content is on the right. Having the test run list on the right feels inverted relative to muscle memory and common UI patterns. This makes quick scanning and navigation slower and mildly frustrating.

#### Proposal

Add a user/workspace setting and/or a compact toggle button in the Test Results view toolbar to choose the layout orientation, for example:

```
"testing.resultsView.layout": "treeLeft" | "treeRight" (default: "treeRight")
```

When set to `treeLeft`, the test run / test item explorer column would be rendered on the left, with the selected test output/details on the right.

#### Benefits

- Consistency: Aligns with the mental model established by the Explorer, Debug, Git, and Extensions views.
- Usability: Reduces cognitive friction and cursor travel—eyes start at left for hierarchical navigation.
- Low risk: Purely optional; default can remain as-is to avoid surprising existing users.

Thanks for considering!

See also our [issue reporting guidelines](https://aka.ms/vscodeissuereporting).

Happy Coding!

ah, nevermind, I think I had someone request this in a message to me but did not actually make an issue for it earlier

body: Type: Bug Release Notes for 1.104 have a section titled "Hide and disable GitHub Copilot AI features" https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_104#_hide-and-disable-github-copilot-ai-features which includes this sentence: > The command to "Hide AI Features" was renamed to reflect this change and will now reveal this new setting in the settings editor. But it doesn't name the command, nor can I find it in Command Palette. The Keyboard Shortcuts editor reveals it to be titled `Chat: Learn How to Hide AI Features` and to have the id `workbench.action.chat.hideSetup`. The code indicates the command only shows if I haven't already set up chat: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/9ea52a05709d5883caff288cd15f870abb00f413/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatSetup.ts#L1322-L1340 Specifically in the precondition (L1330) I think this should be removed to help me discover that I can hide AI features per-workspace. Pinging @bpasero VS Code version: Code 1.104.2 (e3a5acfb517a443235981655413d566533107e92, 2025-09-24T11:21:37.073Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

comments.body:
I wasn't able to test my hypothesis because the ChatEntitlementService in OSS lacks a value for its `context` property as a result of this code:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/66f7cad3a9525ebbb7f4dccacd5848e03a746954/src/vs/workbench/services/chat/common/chatEntitlementService.ts#L282-L284

then this code prevents the command from getting registered:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/66f7cad3a9525ebbb7f4dccacd5848e03a746954/src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatSetup.ts#L1222-L1226

Thanks for the feedback and the PR. However for users that have installed Copilot successfully we do not really want to give them an action that they can use to shoot themselves in the foot.

Thus I am not sure adding this command to the title menu makes sense. Users can always uninstall Copilot and then trigger this command.
Also the title menu when copilot is installed is already crowded.

Disabling AI per workspace should be done by disabling Copilot per workspace as an extension.

Let's keep this open for more discussion for now.

@isidorn did you try my PR? As noted above, I wasn't able to test it on OSS (maybe there's a trick you can teach me). But the PR only relaxes the `precondition` of the action. It doesn't change the `when` clause for its presence in `MenuId.ChatTitleBarMenu`. So I'm only expecting the change to cause the command to appear in Command Palette in circumstances where it currently does not. It shouldn't affect the title menu.

Also, disabling AI for a workspace by using a setting in .vscode/settings.json ensures that all users of the workspace get AI disabled. Relying on each user to disable the Copilot extension explicitly for the workspace isn't a substitute IMO.

labels.name: under-discussion
labels.description: Issue is under discussion for relevance, priority, approach

title: Command `Chat: Learn How to Hide AI Features` is missing from Command Palette

<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
Couldn't find this issue anywhere in this repo, so I created it. If it's a dupe, please tell me...
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Testing with extensions disabled did not solve the problem.

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
And Bissect did not help any further than telling me the issue may be coming from Code.
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104.2
- OS Version: Windows 11 24H2

Steps to Reproduce:

[zipped MP4 video](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22557646/bug.zip)
1. Don't close the file, just directly close Code
2. Open Code again
You should notice the Run button is missing
3. Open another file or start a draft
4. Go back to the script
You should notice the Run button came back

This is kinda annoying. Can this get fixed, please ?

About the recently added _new release_ tag : I think this problem might be older than that, but don't know since which version...

comments.body: Hi! Thank you for the video! Will investigate
Good news, I've just upgraded to 1.104.3 and now I only need to wait arround 1 second to get the run button after opening Code ! Closing as completed... ( feel free to reopen if needed )

Um nevermind. After further testing, it appears that this bug happens especially for big scripts. The script I've tested when closing this issue was a simple and short one. Maybe because the initial code analysis is taking too much time ? But it should still be able to show the run button again once all the script have been checked, even if it took more than 10 seconds.

title: Run button missing until leaving and coming back to script
